title: Digital Product Owner Web - Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **Join us on our transformation journey to the digital future.**


At **Volvo Group Digital & IT**, we have a clear ambition to enable value creation at scale for the Volvo Group. With a new product centric operating model and digital technologies, we will produce digital offerings that are profitable, scalable, and differentiated. With Volvo Group Digital & IT, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals, who learn continuously and embrace change to stay ahead.

 **Digital Delivery** is a function within Group Digital & IT. We have the ambition to identify and execute on new digital initiatives in tight collaboration with business areas across the Volvo Group, modernize and transform existing solutions and products, and to secure agile ways of working across the Volvo Group, modernize and transform existing solutions and products, and to secure agile ways of working across the Digital Delivery function.

  

We are a team of approximately 3 000 people, present in Sweden, India, Poland, China, Brazil, France and USA.

 **This will be you - your new challenge**


As a Digital Product Owner (DPO), you will collaborate with Digital Product Managers, engineers, UX designers, data analysts, and stakeholders to continuously enhance our products and user experience. We operate in an environment where ideas are shared, ambitions are aligned, and the future is created together.

 **This is how you could make an impact**


As DPO, you will own a specific part of the digital product, champion its vision, and translate the roadmap into deliverables aligned with the overall strategy. You will manage the team backlog, prioritize tasks, and drive execution within a stable, high-performing team.

  

Leading the **Digital Experience (DEX) Adobe Web (.com) team**, you’ll report to the Head of Digital Experience and support multiple Volvo Group brands, business areas, and group functions. The scope includes **Volvo Group Public Web (.com)** on **Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) CS**, the designated **CMS platform** for Volvo Group. The team is based in Europe, with expansion planned in Bangalore, India.

 **These will be some selected responsibilities:**

* Support the team in creating product specifications in the form of user stories with acceptance criteria, to ensure the stable team have all required information to deliver the desired outcome.
* Lead the product discovery process for assigned capabilities (including hypothesis generation, requirements gathering, design, and scoping) in collaboration with the digital product managers, UX designers, data analysts, and engineers.
* Assist the Digital Product Managers in ensuring that the product development backlog is properly organized, prioritized, and kept up to date.
* Contribute to the product vision and champion this vision with stakeholders and the stable team.
* Ensure that proper analytics, tracking and data collection mechanisms are in place to understand user behaviors and/or product performance.
* Provide the necessary product support to the stable team as may be required to aid their delivery.
* Work with other parts of the organization as needed to ensure expected outcomes are achieved and measured.
* Own team development to secure the team long and short-term plans for proper capacity and competence.
* Continuously reviewing the live product to identify areas for improvement and any deviations from the expected experience.
* Gather insights from data and customer feedback to refine the product.

 **Who are you?**


We believe you want to take your career to the next level, working with amazing people around the world. To succeed in this role, you likely have a **university degree or equivalent experience** and a background in **leading cross-functional teams**, preferably within **IT management**.

  

Extensive experience with the **Adobe AEM CS** is essential, enabling you to help business stakeholders maximize its potential. You also have a strong understanding of **costs, risks, and compliance** related to development and operations to assess value effectively.

 **We believe this role requires:**

* Experience in **digital product orientation** and **agile ways of working**.
* Knowledge of **information technology trends**.
* A passion for **lifelong learning**.
* The ability to work **both independently and collaboratively.**
* Proven skills in **cross-functional collaboration** and managing both **operational performance** and **strategic transformation.**

  

Strong **communication skills** and **fluency in English** are essential for this global role.

 **Location:** Bangalore, India, or Gothenburg, Sweden. Please note that you will be required to work from the local office in either location.

 **Are you curious and have some questions? Please reach out to:**


Sofia Fagrell, Head of Digital Experience - Sofia.fagrell@volvo.com

  

Last application date for this opportunity is 2025-04-20

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: UX-designer
description:
**Välkommen till en grön värld av möjligheter hos oss på Sveaskog. Vi erbjuder dig skogen – en vacker arbetsplats och framför allt ett av våra viktigaste bidrag för att klara utmaningar kopplade till klimatförändringar och framtidens råvaruförsörjning. Nu söker vi dig som är teamorienterad och vill vara med oss på resan.**
**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Att arbeta på Sveaskog innebär stor frihet samtidigt som du förväntas ta ansvar, visa mod och vara nyfiken. I allas uppdrag ingår att ta ansvar för sin egen och verksamhetens utveckling samt att vara teamorienterad och en bra kollega. Vi kallar det aktivt medarbetarskap. Vi erbjuder dig attraktiva förmåner och en arbetsplats som kännetecknas av en vilja att du ska lyckas, där jämställdhet och hållbart arbetsliv står högt på agendan. Sveaskog eftersträvar mångfald och en jämn könsfördelning inom alla yrken i företaget.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Design-teamet befinner sig på en spännande resa och nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och driva utvecklingen av vårt designarbete och stärka användarupplevelsen inom UI/UX-design. I den här rollen får du förbättra kund- och användarupplevelsen, öka kunskapen om designprocesser och design thinking samt säkerställa en enhetlig design tillsammans med våra leverantörer.
   

  

 Du fungerar som länken mellan användare och utvecklingsteam, kvalitetssäkrar designleveranser och skapar prototyper, wireframes och mockups utifrån organisationens behov. Vi ser gärna att du tycker det är roligt att utbilda och inspirera andra, samtidigt som du hittar kreativa och kostnadseffektiva lösningar med fokus på UI.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som vill utvecklas i ditt arbete, vara en del av ett prestigelöst och engagerat företag samt bidra till en grön värld. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som har ett starkt öga för detaljer, som är nyfiken och vill göra skillnad – både för användarna och för Sveaskog.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har nedanstående eller motsvarande förmåga:
   

  

* Du har relevant utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet inom design.
* Har god erfarenhet av att leda arbete i grupp, driva UX-processer och arbeta med tillgänglighetsramverk som WCAG.
* Du har en stark grafisk profil med bred erfarenhet av UI och kan visa upp en portfolio från tidigare projekt.
* Förstår systemutveckling och trivs med agila arbetssätt.
* Är kundorienterad, drivande och kreativ, med en förmåga att sätta dig in i olika verksamhetsområden.
* Du är en god kommunikatör i tal och skrift och har förmåga att skapa och upprätthålla goda relationer.


 Stationering på något utav Sveaskogs nordliga kontor, förslagsvis: Umeå, Luleå, Kalix, Östersund, Karlstad, Piteå och Lycksele.
   

  

**Vill du växa med oss?**
 Den här rekryteringen genomförs i samarbete med Forefront Amplify på uppdrag av Sveaskog.
   

  

**Ansökan sker via formuläret här**
 Har du frågor? Kontakta Malva Svensson, ansvarig rekryterare, via malva.svensson@forefront.se
   

  

 Fackliga kontaktpersoner är för Ledarna Thomas Esbjörnsson, tel 010-544 99 75, för Akademikerföreningen Sara Östh, tel 010-544 97 11 och för Unionen Stig Sjöberg 08-655 90 58.
   

  

**Om Sveaskog**
 Sveaskog är Sveriges största skogsägare och ägs av svenska staten. Bolaget äger 14 procent av Sveriges skogsmarker och har cirka 800 medarbetare runt om i landet. Våra kontor finns från Tärendö i norr till Osby i söder.

title: Graphic Designer / UX
description:
**Responsible for graphic material and UX** 
**Responsible for designing and producing visually engaging content for various marketing channels, events, and promotional campaigns. Ensures that all visual elements align with the organization’s brand, delivering a cohesive and recognizable visual profile across all platforms.** 
**Takes ownership of the user experience (UX) on the THS Business platforms, focusing on leading intuitive, user-friendly designs that improve interaction and engagement. Collaborates closely with the IT group to optimize design solutions that meet both aesthetic and functional goals.**

title: Product Designer - Mobile
description:
🚨
 **This is a non-salaried, equity-only role. Please only apply if you’re excited to join an early-stage mission-driven startup** 




  





 We’re building Trustyou – a digital parenting app that focuses on trust, online safety, and healthy digital habits. Think of it as the next-gen version of parental control apps — without the control.
 



  





 Kids today spend hours online. But most parenting tools focus on blocking or spying. We’re doing the opposite. We’re building something that helps families solve problems together.
 



  





 If a child feels lonely online, is bullied in a chat, or starts showing signs of stress, our app doesn’t just send an alert. It helps the parent understand what’s going on, and gives them practical tools to support their child — emotionally, socially, and digitally.
 



  





 We’re early-stage. Accepted into one of Sweden’s top incubators. Building our MVP and raising funds now. You’ll join us part-time at this stage and play a key role in shaping what this product becomes.
 



  





**You’ll work on:** 



* Wireframes and user flows (parent and child apps)
* Mobile-first UX/UI design in Figma
* Creating a friendly and intuitive experience for both kids and adults
* A/B testing ideas for onboarding, check-ins, and nudges
* Building clickable prototypes for testing and development



  





**You are:** 



* 3 years experienced in mobile app design (iOS/Android)
* Great at simplifying complex flows
* Strong in Figma
* Curious about user behavior (especially families and kids)
* Proactive — you bring ideas, not just pixels



  





**Apply** 
 :
 



 Send your LinkedIn or CV. Let us know what product you’ve worked on and what you actually did.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Avalanche Studios Group is looking for a passionate and skilled UX/UI Designer. At Avalanche Studios Group you will work with some of the industry’s most exciting technology and talented individuals. As a UX/UI Designer, you will be collaborating with other disciplines & product owners to ensure quality, usability, consistency, and compliance across all deliverables. You will create deliverables including but not limited to: user flows, wireframes, high-fidelity designs and prototypes to communicate vision and strategy.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who has a fluency in a variety of design crafts (UX, UI, Design Systems, Prototyping) as well as expert proficiency in industry standard design tools. The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of inclusive design practices and is capable and a strong understanding of best practices in open world action gameplay design UX.
   

  

 To be considered for this role you need to submit a portfolio showcasing your skills and examples of your work.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Apply conceptual thinking while considering user-needs, experience goals and technical feasibility
* Work closely with development teams to ensure that design specifications are met and implemented
* Work with project managers to fill out design criteria in JIRA and ensure requirements are outlined for development
* Regularly seek out and incorporate feedback into iterative UX/UI improvements
* Collaborate and communicate regularly with other discipline partners
* Be an advocate for Player-First, Fun-First, thinking within design


**Who You Are**
* Several years of in-depth UX/UI design experience in development teams within the gaming industry
* Ability to create UI assets to releasable quality
* Strategic design thinking, processes and design system related work experience
* Capable of managing multiple priorities simultaneously
* Understands and advocates for the importance of data-driven decisions
* A drive for designing engaging game mechanics while reducing player frustration and unnecessary complexity.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills and experience articulating design strategy
* Continually strive to exceed expectations


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Product Designer
company_industry: Consumer Services and Technology, Information and Media
description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real. Hear us out. The story of Nextory began in Syria, where our founders grew up. When they were children, they witnessed how the dictatorship limited the access to books, and saw what it did to their country. So when Shadi and Ninos came to Sweden, they made it their mission to make books available to everyone.
 



  





 Fast forward a few years, and Nextory was born. We offer a monthly subscription where our users can read and listen to as many books as they like. Sounds like a pretty cool product to work with, right? We think so too.
 



  





**So who are we looking for?** 




 We’re on the lookout for a seasoned Product Designer who’s ready to take the lead in shaping great user experiences. You’ll own the design process end-to-end, guiding your product team toward impactful outcomes. Working in a cross-functional team, you’ll play a key role in making our apps more engaging by helping users discover great content in a way that feels seamless and intuitive.
 



  





 You’re confident across the entire design process — from understanding user needs to testing prototypes and delivering design specs.
 



  





 Since our design team at Nextory is small, your impact will be big. You’ll help evolve our design system, bring our brand to life in the product, and contribute to a culture of design excellence.
 



  





 We’d love it if you’re a book lover, but what truly matters is your passion for solving user needs, your design expertise, and your ability to collaborate and bring good energy to the team.
 



  





**What you will do** 




 Be a key player in Team Spark, a cross-functional team focused on activating new users as well as making sure all users discover the right content at the right time in our iOS and Android
 



 apps.Own the design process end-to-end — from understanding user needs to prototyping, testing, and delivering high-quality design specs.
 



  





 Blend craft with impact by making thoughtful design decisions that drive real results, linking your work to user insights and team goals.
 



  





 Dive into user insights, conducting research and qualitative testing to refine and improve your designs.
 



  





 Champion a culture of design excellence, pushing UX/UI forward and inspiring those aro
 



 und you.Collaborate openly, inviting others into your process and valuing different perspectives to create the best possible experiences.
 



  





 Shape and evolve Nextory’s Design System, ensuring consistency while keeping things fresh and scalable.
 



  





 Stay curious and ahead of the curve, keeping up with industry trends to make sure our designs remain innovative and competitive.
 



  





 Who you areAround 5 years of experience as a product designer, designing and shipping digital products or services.
 



  





 A strong portfolio showcasing your visual design, interaction, and UX skills.
 



 Proficiency in design tools like Figma and Adobe Creative Suite.
 



  





 A solid grasp of user-centered design principles and methodologies.
 



  





 Great communication and collaboration skills—you enjoy sharing ideas and working closely with others.
 



  





 Fluent in English.
 



  





 A degree in Design or a related field is a plus, but what really matters is your skills and experience.
 



  





 Bonus skills in content design or motion? Even better!
 



  





 What else? If you love expressing yourself through gifs in Slack, like to get geeky about icons, or have a passion for kebab, you’ll fit right into our design team.
 



  





 Think we’re a match? Then we can’t wait to hear from you! Prep a few cases from your portfolio that you think would be convincing for this position,
 



 and send them over.
 



  





 Cheers!
 



  





 WORK ENVIRONMENT AND IMPORTANT DETAILS
 



 At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success - and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of the working time at our beautiful office!
 



  





 We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in Paris and Bangalore. Our hybrid work policy includes four days in the office and Wednesdays as a work-from-home day.
 



  





 Please note that we do not offer relocation and that we apply a 6-month probationary period.

title: Technical SEO Specialist
description:
**What We Do**
 We are passionate believers in the power of education to transform people’s lives. We play our part by helping students to make one of the most important decisions of their lifetime; finding, applying, and enrolling in the right study program. Our multi-sided platforms help over 120 million prospective students every year to find their ideal match from over 5500 partner institutions on our global network of over 500 student websites.
   

  

 It’s a complicated, and diverse problem space and we work tirelessly to understand the needs of each individual student, and each individual institution, and use the power of technology to recommend the best matches for the benefit of both parties.
   

  

 At Keystone, we work energetically with all aspects of SEO, and we also get recognition for these, as an example we have twice been rewarded for the best SEO work in our field in Sweden.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a driven and passionate Technical SEO Specialist with a few years' experience, who wants to take the next exciting step in the career.
   

  

 Driving organic traffic is a core part of our business and something that breathes withing the whole organization. You will be joining the product and tech team. Well-formulated communication skills will be needed, speaking to engineers, PMs, UX, and stakeholders in the business, with non-technical terms.
   

  

 You will be a central part of the continuous growth journey that we have in front of us.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Crawling and finding issues at scale on websites targeting a global audience.
* Research organic growth opportunities and provide actionable insights on how to achieve them.
* Analyze website traffic, internal linking structures, data related to indexing, and other elements to provide recommendations for optimization.
* Optimize site structures, URLs, and internal linking.
* Stay up to date with SEO industry trends and Google algorithm changes to ensure we adapt accordingly.
* Collaborate with web developers, Product Managers, UX and Marketing to implement SEO best practices.
* With a data-driven approach continually investigate different data sources to see how we can enrich content at scale.


**What We’re Looking For**
* At least 2 years of experience working within the SEO industry.
* Good understanding of industry tools such as Screaming Frog, Sitebulb, Oncrawl or similar.
* Good understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* In-depth understanding of GA4 and GSC.
* Skilled in Google Sheets/Excel being able to draw insights from raw data.
* Good understanding of how search engines work.
* A burning passion for SEO in general, and knowledge of what it takes to create good content for users.
* Good proficiency in the English language, and able to communicate technical things in a non-technical way.
* Understanding of international SEO is highly preferred.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Proficiency in Python.
* Have experimented with Large Language Model APIs.
* Experience in larger site migrations.
* Experience in creating technical SEO documentation, guidelines and valuable reports.
* Experience in holding presentations and workshops for larger audiences.


**What can we offer you?**
* An International and open working atmosphere with colleagues of many nationalities.
* To be in the lead of a fast-growing company.
* Plenty of space for initiative and the ability to grow your own skills and experience.
* Awesome colleagues and a social working environment.
* Hybrid working, but with a team that also enjoys meeting up IRL and having a Friday beer or Monday breakfast at the office found centrally in Stockholm.
* To be a part of a team who cares deeply for our customers.


**What's the team like?**
 You will be a part of the Product team, working closely on a day-to-day basis with our in-house engineering team.
   

  

 You will be reporting to our Senior Technical SEO Manager and be part of a larger product and tech team consisting of 30+ engineers and product managers from diverse backgrounds and experiences.
   

  

 Collaborative, ambitious and driven best describes us. You will be joining a strong and growing team with great chemistry who are passionate about what they do and always go the extra mile to reach their goals. Read more about us here: https://www.keg.com/
   

  

 Do you want to join our family? Please send us your application by hitting the button "Apply here!".
   

  

*Keystone is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Design Area Manager
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*




**Om tjänsten** 




 Som Design Area Manager har du en nyckelroll i att säkerställa en värdeskapande kundupplevelse och en effektiv designorganisation. Du leder och utvecklar ett team av Product Designers och arbetar såväl strategiskt- som operativt för att våra designlösningar ska vara en drivkraft för både kundnöjdhet och för att uppnå Fortnox övergripande mål.I rollen som Design Area Manager inom affärsområdet Business Platform arbetar du i nära samarbete med Product- och Development Area Managers för ditt och angränsande område. Tillsammans identifierar, validerar och prioriterar ni utmaningar kring kunder och användare inom området eller specifik målgrupp. Du har även personalansvar för de Product Designers som tillhör ditt produktområde. Tillsammans utvecklar ni produkter och tidiga koncept som balanserar värde för användaren med affärsmässig potential och möjlighet att realiseras. Du rapporterar till Head of Design för affärsområdet.
 







**Om dig**




 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en gedigen erfarenhet av ledarskap inom design. Du har således mångårig framgångsrik erfarenhet av att både driva och direkt leda UX/UI-projekt och design team. Du har en förmåga att systematiskt identifiera förbättringsområden, arbeta metodiskt med förändringsledning och skapa strukturerade processer som driver långsiktig utveckling. Samtidigt är du en inspirerande ledare som bygger en samarbetskultur där alla arbetar mot gemensamma mål. För att trivas och passa in på Fortnox är det viktigt att du är enkel och prestigelös, pålitlig och drivs av innovation och ständig utveckling. Du är en kommunikativ och samarbetsinriktad lagspelare som har ett tydligt kund- och affärsfokus.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**








 Du är en kreativ tänkare med flerårig erfarenhet av att både driva och leda UX/UI-projekt och designteam.
 











 Du har gedigen erfarenhet av produktdesign (
 *konsument-appar med stora användarbaser* 
 ) och utveckling av digitala produkter.
 











 Med din erfarenhet tänker du holistiskt och du kan både sätta upp visioner och mål och på ett inspirerande vis leda dem.
 











 Du har en förmåga att kommunicera koncept och lösningar tydligt och effektivt till stakeholders, team och användare.
 











 Du är skicklig i designverktyg som Figma, FigJam, Adobe, de vanliga branschstandarddesignverktygen, och håller ledigt strukturerade workshops.
 











 Att använda UX-designprocesser för att designa lösningar för användar- och affärsutmaningar är helt naturligt för dig.
 











 Du är stark på prototypsidan och har god erfarenhet av kund/användar-research
 



  





**Om Fortnox** 








*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* 
*www.fortnox.se* 
*.* 




**Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 21 april 2025!**

title: Product Manager
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 You'll work closely with designers, engineers, specialist stakeholders, and the Product director to develop consumer facing products, which form a core part of our platform and value proposition. You will act as the voice of our customers and be a stable bridge between engineering and the business. You will also help the team function as an empowered product team by setting the right product culture and vision, and help the team deliver high quality impactful features.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
 In this role, you’ll stand over the one of the exciting product suite at Juni. Your R&R would cover:
   

  

* Product Strategy and Vision: Defining the strategic direction of your area, aligning them with the company's overall business strategy. This involves creating product roadmaps that outline planned features and enhancements based on customer feedback, competitors, market demands and business priorities.
* Customer Experience: Lead the vision for financial experience within the platform- bank transfer, invoice payment, credit usage etc. Ensure the financial and banking features are chain-linked into cohesive end-to-end workflows. Work with designers to build UX that WoWs customers.
* Empowered Product Team: Setting the right product culture within your product team that empowers all team members to empathise with customer pain points and understand the impact of features they are building.
* Customer Research: Conduct thorough customer research to understand customer (ICP) needs, market trends, and the competitive landscape. This includes gathering insights through customer interviews, surveys, and data analysis.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Working closely with various departments such as engineering, design, commercial, and finance to ensure effective product development and launch. This includes facilitating communication and alignment among different teams.
* Product Development Oversight: Managing the product backlog, prioritizing features, and working closely with development teams to ensure timely and high-quality delivery of banking products
* Market Positioning and training: Developing strategies for positioning and pricing products in the market. Ensuring that the commercial teams have been trained on product features and value propositions clearly understood by all.


**Within 1 Month You Will**
* Understand how Juni’s product teams work
* Be integrated with your team
* Ship your first features 🚢


**Within 3 Months You Will Have**
* Stronghold of your teams' growth metrics
* Deep understanding of your team’s roadmap
* Shipped many features and fix critical bugs 🐛


**Within 6 Months You Will**
* Oversee delivery against your metrics and roadmap (with some bumps along the way)
* Set 12-month rolling vision for your product domain
* Actively participate in customer research to understand the voice of customer


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Google suite
* Notion
* BI tools
* Slack


**Qualifications 👑**
 What we need to see:
   

  

* Familiarity with fintech and financial services (preferably from Sweden)
* Experience in activation, onboarding, pricing
* Good understanding of Swedish and global payment eco-system
* 3+ years of product manager experience


**What We’d Love To See**
* Experience in working with sales, onboarding and credit teams
* 5+ years of overall experience
* Engineering or computer science degree


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Awesome.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Product Design Manager
description:
**About Us** 




  





**At FDJ United, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




 FDJ United is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels,
 **FDJ United** 
 is your playing field.
 



**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




  





**The role** 




 As a Product Design Manager you will be focused on the development, growth and evolution of a group of Product Designers. You will ensure development combines the wants and needs of the individuals with the general direction and maturity of the UX team. The role is people oriented and will allow Product Designers to focus on what they do best, design.​
 



  





**What you will do** 



* Provide line management for a group of Product Designers, usually, but not exclusively in the same geographic location​
* Clearly define training and development plans to meet individual career aspirations and wider team needs ​
* Work with Principal Product Designers and DesignOps to manage resource demands, capability​ and allocation improvements
* Help grow Product Design capability and understanding to meet wider business need and priorities​
* Support UX management and Principals to ensure there is clarity on delivery roadmaps across various teams​
* Monitor and develop better ways of supporting and managing resource through transition to a flexible working approach​
* Collaborate with global peers on a consistent but flexible approach to managing our people in alignment with global and local HR requirements ​
* Be the go-to person for other areas of the business where resource capacity management is concerned​
* Contribute to the goal of providing our customers with a world class experience​
* Bring an outside in perspective to how best to run a global team, drawing on experience gained through exposure to different organisations and industries​
* Ensure team members adhere to HR and Security requirements, for example data security, fraud and industry relevant codes​
* Implement and monitor team satisfaction measurements working with UX management to address areas of concern
* Proactively support other managers, both within the same structure and across the business, to educate and develop a 'best in class' management framework​
* Help keep the team healthy by developing the design culture and providing ways to keep things fresh and engaging
* Ensure that you, and your team, adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations within your direct responsibility and control.
* Ensure any non-compliance incidents within your team are raised through the appropriate channels (Compliance Incidents Process) and that your team are informed of any reporting processes relevant to them.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Ensure your team's completion of all mandatory compliance trainings within the set deadline.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





**Your experience** 



* Extensive experience managing a team working within a cross-functional delivery set-up​
* Expert knowledge of guiding and supporting team development with or without a background in the discipline​
* Ability to work with UX leaders to align and more importantly address resource challenges/conflicts​
* Experience of building an understanding of team members career aspirations and working with them to identify relevant training and development
* Proactive and patient individual who can understand the small and big picture and how it affects their team​
* Experience onboarding team members by both following & adapting global process to ensure new team members have a frictionless and rewarding joining experience​
* Extensive knowledge measuring team effectiveness and satisfaction​
* Experience supporting and educating the Objective & Key Result (OKR) framework



  





**Our Way Of Working** 




 Our world is hybrid.
 



 A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



  





**Application Process** 




 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

title: iOS Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking audio innovation. We are home to Marshall, Natal Drums, Urbanears and adidas headphones.
   

  

 For over sixty years, we’ve amplified the sound of the world’s most talented artists. We’ve brought their music to crowds and solo listeners everywhere. We give sound a design that resonates with ears and eyes, as well as at a deeper cultural level. No matter the scene or music genre, we aim to excite, intrigue and surprise.
   

  

 Bridging iconic rock ‘n’ roll heritage with cutting-edge innovation and culture-driven brand-building, our group activities span professional music equipment, consumer electronics, live events, a record label, and more.
   

  

 We empower around 800 highly talented people across 8 global locations. Our products are sold in over 90 markets worldwide, totalling a combined annual turnover of USD 360 million.
   

  

***Right now,***
 we need to strengthen our Application Development team with an iOS developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Maintain and develop iOS mobile apps for the Marshall Brand.
* Contribute to the design and implemention of a scalable solution for our new iOS platform.
* Collaborate closely with our UX and firmware teams in developing and implementing our new features and functions.
* Support and participate in the testing and evaluation of the app's integration with the firmware.
* Drive knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Define processes and frameworks for our newly established team.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who We’re Looking For**
 We are looking for an experienced iOS developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be a committed driver with a problem-solving approach, focused on building quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, new trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You Probably Have The Following Experiences & Skills**
* 5+ years experience in iOS app development
* Experience working with Swift, Swift UI and Swift package manager.
* Proficient in modern iOS design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection)
* Strong understanding of the Combine framework
* Familiarity interacting with Firebase and Clean Architecture
* Good understanding of the developer testing infrastructure (Unit testing, UI tests, Jenkins, etc.)


 It's beneficial if you understand the Bluetooth stack, communication over GATT and AVKit; and WiFi stack.
   

  

 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, and it will in the end lead to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 If you have a passion for App development and want to work for a growing company with a start-up mindset, this job is a perfect match for you. Please send us your resume as soon as possible as we are reviewing candidates continuously.
   

  

*We look forward to reviewing your application!*

title: AI Solutions Engineer
description:
Do you want to apply cutting-edge AI to improve medical imaging and patient outcomes? We’re seeking an AI Solutions Engineer to design and deploy AI systems that empower radiologists and healthcare providers worldwide. In this role, you’ll build and scale AI solutions for our global medical imaging platform, from prototyping to production, working alongside Commercial, Product, and Customer Success teams.
 



  





  





 In this role, you will develop, implement, and optimize AI-powered systems for our global medical imaging platform and our customer facing functions. You’ll be responsible for creating end-to-end solutions - from proof-of-concept (POC) prototypes to production-ready applications - working closely with our Commercial, Customer Success, Integration and Product Engineering teams. The ideal candidate brings strong technical skills, an entrepreneurial mindset, and an understanding of B2B SaaS and Healthcare/Life Science workflows.
 



  





 At Collective Minds, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, international team that is transforming how healthcare professionals work with cutting-edge tools that improve both efficiency and patient care. You’ll have the opportunity to build solutions that make a real impact in healthcare delivery globally. Are you ready to embark on this journey?
 



  





 Responsibilies:
 


* Partner with Product, Commercial, and Customer Success teams to integrate AI tools into clinical workflows and customer-facing processes
* Design and develop AI-powered solutions for medical imaging applications, integrating LLMs, Agentic frameworks, computer vision, and traditional ML approaches
* Build full-stack AI prototypes and production systems, including backend APIs, frontend interfaces, and data pipelines
* Create and optimize data processing workflows for AI model training, fine-tuning, and evaluation
* Develop high-throughput DICOM pipelines for ingesting, preprocessing, and analyzing medical
* images
* Apply MCP (Model Context Protocol) to improve AI model interoperability and performance
* Research and prototype emerging AI/ML techniques (e.g., multimodal LLMs) to keep our platform at the forefront of innovation
* Own end-to-end AI project execution, from scoping requirements to deployment in clinical environments
* Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for AI systems and processes
* Continuously evaluate and improve AI model performance based on user feedback and metrics



  





 Desired Skills And Qualifications:
 


* BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent technical field
* Strong Python programming skills and software development best practices
* Experience with containerization technologies like Docker
* Familiarity with Agentic frameworks, LLMs, prompt engineering, vector databases, and embedding technologies
* Understanding of data processing pipelines and workflows
* Ability to build end-to-end AI solutions, from concept to production
* Demonstrated experience with full-stack development (frontend, backend, data integration)
* Knowledge of AI ethics principles, particularly in healthcare applications
* Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
* Excellent communication skills for explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Self-motivated with ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Ability to drive all work in English



  





 Extra points:
 


* DICOM expertise and medical data standards (e.g., HL7,FHIR)
* Healthcare compliance knowledge (HIPAA, GDPR,GxP)
* UI/UX design for clinical tools
* Radiology / Medical imaging hands on experience
* Startup/scrappy prototyping mindset

title: Mobile iOS Developer
description:
The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for an iOS Developer to join the Electronic Access Control (EAC) product unit. If you are passionate about mobile app development and have a track record of building successful iOS applications, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Join our team based in Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile IOS Developer**
 As an iOS Developer you will develop mobile applications for our different Electronic Access Control systems. You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and release new features.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least three years' experience of mobile iOS app development, preferably with Swift.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with Swift UI and good understanding of iOS release cycle.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following – development of mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, Swift UI, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, security technologies such as TLS, Keychain, MFA, OAuth and PKI, iOS development, cross platform languages such as React native (expo), Kotlin multi-platform or Flutter, SAFe agile methodology. I addition, you share our belief in lean and agile values, with an open mind set, cross-functional teams, where many competences are working together for successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Erfaren Webbredaktör till myndighet i Stockholm.
description:
Webbredaktör
   

  

 Erfaren Webbredaktör till myndighet i Stockholm.
   

  

 Enheten för digitala kanaler på kommunikationsavdelningen söker en erfarenhet webbredaktör under
   

  

 en föräldraledighet.
   

  

 – Stationering Stockholm
   

  

 – Omfattning: Heltid 100%
   

  

 – Start 2025-05-12
   

  

 – Längd: 2025-10-30, eventuellt längre.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Du blir anställd av Poolia men jobbar hos vår kund.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter i huvudsak
   

  

 Naturvårdsverket är i behov av en webbredaktör till enheten för digitala kanaler på
   

  

 Kommunikationsavdelningen.
   

  

 Ditt arbete kan omfatta, men är inte begränsat till, följande uppgifter:
   

  

 – Operativt arbete med webbpublicering på framför allt naturvardsverket.se och Naturvårdsverkets intranät i Optimizely (fd
   

  

 Episever).
   

  

 – Webbansvar för olika prioriterade kommunikationsfrågor, inklusive publicering, SEO och webbanalys
   

  

 – Kvalificerat innehållsarbete på intranätet: delta i översyn av innehållsstruktur etc
   

  

 – UX-stöd i olika processer och projekt
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 För att vara aktuell förtjänsten, behöver du uppfylla nedan kriterier:
   

  

 – Du har utbildning inom kommunikation, digital kommunikation eller likvärdig utbildning.
   

  

 – Du har minst tre (3) års arbetslivserfarenhet från liknande arbete som är relevant för uppdraget.
   

  

 – Likvärdig arbetslivserfarenhet är exempelvis att ha arbetat med webbkommunikation på strategisk och operativ nivå.
   

  

 – Goda kunskaper om webbpublicering i Optimizely.
   

  

 – Goda kunskaper i Photoshop.
   

  

 – Goda kunskaper i svenska avseende tal och skrift.
   

  

**Meriterande**
 – Goda kunskaper SEO.
   

  

 – Konsulten bör ha goda kunskaper om innehållsutveckling på intranät
   

  

 – Konsulten bör ha erfarenhet av arbete med UX/användarupplevelser.
   

  

 Om verksamheten
   

  

 Låter detta som ett uppdrag för dig? Då är du välkommen att söka via länken i annonsen. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden gått ut.
   

  

 Eventuell intervju hos kund kommer ske i v 17 då du behöver vara tillgänglig.
   

  

 Välkommen!

title: Android Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software team with a Android developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Maintain and develop Android mobile apps for the Marshall brands
* Collaborate closely with our UX and Design team to discuss new features and functions.
* Support and participate in testing activities and evaluation of the app.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Teamwork with the other developers to help us brainstorm solutions and make our apps even better for our users.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are an Android developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be committed to collaborative problem-solving, and build quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* + 2 years of proven professional Android app development experience.
* Experience working with Kotlin.
* Proficient in modern android design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection) and Jetpack components.
* Familiarity with coroutines and Compose, Dagger Hilt and Clean Architecture.
* Good understanding of Firebase & REST etc.
* Hence strong written and spoken English skills are essential.
* Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is a plus.


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Solution Architect for the Private Wealth Management Area \u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with a technology function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.  

  

Are you an architect with ambitions of being part of transforming SEB into a data driven digital bank of the future within the Private Wealth Management area? Then look no further and start reading below.

**What will you be doing?**
Your formal role will be Solution Architect working within the Private Wealth Management area (i.e. investments and trading in stocks, funds, management of client portfolio and advisory). Private Wealth Management is one of the strategic focus areas of SEB and you will be part of the exciting journey ahead of us. The area is undergoing a strong digitalization trend and transformation with a rapidly growing interest in digital investments and wealth management. The transformation is based on customer demands of an excellent digital service as well as technology advancements within e.g. use of data, AI, cloud and front-end graphical user interfaces. Finally, there is no doubt that being data driven for real is key and data will be the core of future digital services.

Your responsibility will be to:* Shape and drive SEB’s architecture transformation agenda for the Private Wealth Management area primarily focusing on our customer segments within private wealth management and family offices. A key to success is a close collaboration with other parts of SEB regarding i.e. front-end applications, authorization, cloud, API and data management.
* Drive change, transformations and modernizations towards our target architecture.
* Interact with other architects in relevant parts of SEB to be able to align and materialize your architecture roadmaps. You will also be part of the SEB architect community.
* Communicate with stakeholders within business and operations to truly understand needs, anchor your ideas and shape sustainable solutions.
* Finally, you will be part of a smaller team of solution architects focusing on the Private Wealth Management area. The team is led by the domain architect for the area that you will interact closely with.


In short, this is a role where you will be a trusted advisor for stakeholders within Business, Business Operations and Technology and be accountable for the architecture to meet client and business needs of private wealth management and family office services.

**Who are you?*** You are well founded in the IT area and your proposals are based on a solid understanding of existing IT solutions considering possibilities of new technology.
* You have previous experience from working with architecture. It would also be a clear advantage if you have experience from front-end user interfaces, data architecture, API design, event-driven architecture, cloud, trading/portfolio systems and/or savings and investment or capital markets solutions.
* You have an interest and experience in interacting with senior business representatives and possess strong inter-personal and cooperation skills. At the same time, you can still maintain a strong hands-on drive and a goal-oriented approach with the ability to bridge between IT and Business.
* You are a change agent with proven ability to interact with and inspire other architects, tech leads and business representatives to reach architectural objectives.
* You have well-developed oral and written communication skills where you easily visualize your ideas, architecture roadmaps and can adjust communication based on target audience.
* You can combine a pragmatic approach with a creative and innovative mindset to find sustainable solutions to business challenges.
* You assume personal accountability for creating and delivering high-value results.
* Equally important as any formal training or education is that you have a true passion for the Private Wealth Management and Family Office area and for architecture with a strong interest in keeping you updated on the relevant trends in the industry and technology.


**What we offer*** Innovative company in the forefront of technology
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views


**Ready to join?**
Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute in this role. Since we select candidates continuously, send in your application already today, but no later than 2025-04-25. If you have questions about the position, please contact Niclas Strååt (hiring manager), +46 739 23 43 or niclas.straat@seb.se.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: IT/OT Specialist
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**

**Join our IT Team supporting the Grid Integration HVDC business in Ludvika, part of Hitachi Energy. HVDC specializes in innovative and reliable solutions for power transmission and distribution, supporting efficient and sustainable energy systems worldwide.**

  

As a Site IT/OT Service Delivery Specialist in Ludvika, you will support IT/OT solutions and services, working closely with business leaders and IT stakeholders. Your role includes managing IT infrastructure, applications, and ticket escalations, as well as supporting both office and shop floor IT/OT assets.


You will be working in close collaboration with the Service Delivery Specialist for HVDC Ludvika, ensuring business needs are met and overall satisfaction with IT services. Additionally, you will play a crucial role in integrating IT with the business operations, enhancing connectivity and cybersecurity for all operational technologies.

*“This is a new, dynamic and fast-moving area where you will have the opportunity to influence and grow in the role and within the company. “– Britt Marie Gustafsson, GPG HVDC IT Service Delivery Manager.*

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support the business in their growth
* Overseeing and acting as a point of contact for the IT/OT environment and responding to emergencies
* Supporting the Service Delivery Specialist who is responsible for the HVDC site in Ludvika
* Participate in planning, developing, implementing and maintaining the HVDC IT/OT environment
* You are a team player who can also handle tasks independently and take on responsibility
* You have a willingness to learn and try new things and enjoy collaborating with others

**Your background**

* You have 3-5 years of work experience, ideally in a similar role
* Experience with manufacturing operations methods, processes, and change management is an advantage
* You have experience handling complex stakeholder scenarios and cross-functional problem solving. You also have a solid understanding of IT procedures, policies, and end-to-end business processes
* Hands-on, installation, troubleshooting etc. on applications & infrastructure
* You are fluent in English and Swedish

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave

title: Tender Engineer – IT/OT
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


Do you want to join us and shape the future and enable the green energy transition? Then we are eager to meet you!


HVDC is a product group in Hitachi Energy. We develop, manufacture, and sell DC transmission systems globally.


We are now looking for a Tender engineer to lead the work within HVDC Control & Protection IT/OT systems.


“You will be a part of our highly skilled Tender team.


We handle customer requirements, validates and gives technical input to the final customer documentation in the tender phase.


You will have key role in the customer dialogue and a big part in defining the solution.” – *Jennie Eklind, Team Manager Tender & Conceptual Design – HVDC Control and Protection IT/OT*.

**How you’ll make an impact**

* You will be technically responsible for defining our IT/OT solutions in tender phase
* Key in this role is collaboration with our customers/partners to ensure that our delivery is according to requirements and standards

* To be proactive in finding solutions & to continuously improve the process
* You are eager to learn and implement experiences from other as well as your work and has a mindset towards continuous improvement

**Your background**

* Experience working in project and bid. You are comfortable meeting customers and participating in technical negotiations
* You have 5+ years of experience working in the field of SCADA, Networking and Cyber Security.
* You have great communication skills and can easily seek and find the needed information
* You have coordinating and planning abilities
* Experience with Azure DevOps is valuable.
* As you will be part of a global business, it is important that you are fluent in English. Knowing Swedish language is meritorious.

title: Produktägare till stadsarkivet
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.

**Vill du vara med och driva den digitala utvecklingen inom Stadsarkivet? Vill du göra skillnad och skapa värde för både organisation och slutanvändare? Då kan rollen som produktägare vara en tjänst för dig!**

### **Välkommen till oss**


Stadsarkivet är stadens informationsnav. Vi hjälper stadens verksamheter med effektiv informationshantering. Våra kärnvärden är engagerad, nyfiken och systematisk. Hos oss på Stadsarkivet arbetar vi kontinuerligt med att utveckla våra arbetssätt för att öka tillgängligheten och värdet av våra tjänster.


Du ingår i Stadsarkivets enhet IT och Digitalisering tillsammans med 30 medarbetare. Enheten har som uppdrag att utveckla och förvalta en portfölj som innehåller IT-arbetsplats, lokal IT försörjning och stadsgemensamma objekt. Vi arbetar operativt med kravfångst, lösningsförslag, utveckling, test och kvalitetssäkring samt support och underhåll. Säkerhet och kostnadseffektivitet är i fokus. Nu introducerar vi agila arbetssätt och vill i samband med det rekrytera en produktägare för Stadsarkivets lokala applikationer


Stadsarkivets lokaler finns på Kungsklippan, ritat av Gunnar Asplund samt på Liljeholmskajen, i Vin och sprits gamla lokaler.

**Hälsning från din framtida chef**


Jag heter Kane Neman och är IT- chef för Stadsarkivet och tillika chef för enheten IT och Digitalisering. Mitt ledarskap präglas av frihet under ansvar, utforska nya lösningar som bidrar till Stadsarkivets vision och ser alltid lösningar. Det som är viktigt för mig är att du har kunden och deras behov i fokus, arbetar inkluderande samt strävar efter utveckling genom ett ständigt lärande.

### **Vi erbjuder**

* trivsamma lokaler i centrala Stockholm
* flextid
* friskvårdsbidrag
* friskvårdstimme 1h/vecka på arbetstid
* semesterväxling vilket innebär fem eller sex extra semesterdagar
* möjlighet att jobba hemifrån när arbetet tillåter.

### **Din roll**


Som produktägare arbetar du i ett tvärfunktionellt team tillsammans med en utvecklare och systemförvaltare för att förvalta och utveckla Stadsarkivets lokala system och applikationer. Rollen innebär att driva digitalisering, automatisering och tillgängliggörande av verksamhetens information.


I dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter ingår bland annat att:

* ha dialog med verksamheten för att fånga upp behov och omvandla dem till tydliga krav och informera om status och framsteg
* skapa och underhålla produktbackloggen, prioritera och förfina krav utifrån kund- och slutanvändarvärde
* definiera produktvisioner och skapa en roadmap för utvecklingen
* hålla presentationer, demos och utbildningar för kunder och slutanvändare
* samarbeta med utvecklingsteamet, dokumentera användningsfall, leda sprintplanering och säkerställa att utvecklingen sker enligt plan
* kvalitetssäkra och testa produkten
* dokumentera och sammanställa rapporter, beslutsunderlag och användarmanualer, ta fram nyckeltal och följa upp produktens utveckling.
* ha ansvar för att ta fram objektplan och säkerställa att målen nås

  

För att lyckas i rollen finns stöd och coachning av både en utbildad agil coach och en förändringsledare.

### **Din kompetens och erfarenhet**


Vi söker dig som har:

* universitet- eller högskoleutbildning inom IT eller annan utbildning som vi bedömer relevant
* god förståelse för hela produktens livscykel, från idé och utveckling till lansering och vidare förbättring
* förståelse för systemarkitektur och tekniska lösningar
* erfarenhet av liknande roll som vår arbetsbeskrivning
* uttrycka dig väl på svenska i både tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du har:

* erfarenhet av rollen som produktägare, objektledare, serviceledare, projektledare eller kravanalytiker
* arbetat med ramverk som PM3 och ITIL
* erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt (SaFe, Scrum och Kanban) och verktyg som JIRA eller DevOps
* certifieringar: Scrum Master, Product Owner eller liknande.

### **Din kompetens och erfarenhet**


Vid rekryteringen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.


För att lyckas i rollen har du en tydlig vision för produkten och kan inspirera ditt team. Du är visionär, initiativrik och har en stark förmåga att strukturera, planera och prioritera ditt arbete på ett effektivt sätt. Ditt arbetssätt är metodiskt vilket gör att du kan hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt utan att tappa fokus på helheten. Samtidigt är du flexibel och hanterar oväntade utmaningar med ett öppet sinne. Du sätter upp tydliga mål och tidsramar och ser till att de hålls. Vidare är du analytisk, lösningsorienterad och innovativ vilket gör att du gärna tänker i nya banor, presenterar idéer och får med dig andra på dina förslag. Med din goda kommunikationsförmåga kommunikationsförmåga är du bryggan mellan verksamhet och IT. Du trivs med att samarbeta och utveckla goda relationer med olika intressenter och strävar alltid efter att leverera värde för kunder och slutanvändare.

### **Övrigt**


För att stärka fokus på de kompetenser och erfarenheter som efterfrågas för denna roll behöver du inte bifoga ett personligt brev. Vid bedömningen av din ansökan kommer vi endast att utgå ifrån ditt CV och ett antal frågor du får besvara i samband med att du söker tjänsten. Vi önskar att du svarar konkret och kortfattat på frågorna, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV.


Arbetspsykologiska tester kommer vara en del i rekryteringsprocessen.


Vi ser mångfald som berikande och välkomnar alla sökande oavsett kön, könsöverskridande identitet eller uttryck, sexuell läggning, etnisk tillhörighet, religion eller annan trosuppfattning, funktionsnedsättning och ålder.

**Länkar**


Se vår film om oss på 90 sek här


Läs gärna mer om våra förmånerhär


Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.  



Läs om Stadsarkivet på vår hemsida:  

https://stadsarkivet.stockholm/

title: Lagringsexpert
description:
Vill du jobba i en komplex miljö med en samhällsviktig funktion som ligger i teknikens framkant? Här finns stora möjligheter för dig som vill utvecklas både på djupet och bredden inom ett eller flera områden. Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsplats med stor flexibilitet i vårt arbetssätt. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!

**Om jobbet**

  

Skatteverket kultur kännetecknas av ett agilt arbetssätt med högt i tak och en öppen dialog för förändring och utveckling. Du blir en del av enheten Skatteverkets Tekniska Tjänster (STT) med cirka 450 medarbetare. Vi ansvarar för utveckling, underhåll och drift och levererar tjänster inom IT infrastruktur, plattformar och IT arbetsplats till flera myndigheter: Skatteverket, Kronofogden, Valmyndigheten, Utbetalningsmyndigheten samt Myndigheten för Digital förvaltning. Du kommer att tillhöra ett agilt team, där varje person har en expertkunskap inom lagring och backup.


Våra lagringslösningar bygger idag på NetApp och vSAN och backup på Commvault. Vi behöver nu en arkitekt/tekniker inom området som arbetar med utveckling och underhåll. I rollen inom ditt område är du en nyckelspelare på Skatteverkets IT-avdelning. Du tillhör Sektionen för server, lagring och virtualisering som utvecklar och underhåller Skatteverkets infrastrukturtjänster. Du ingår i ett team för lagring & backup.


Teamet består av duktiga tekniker och arkitekter inom lagring & backup. Du kommer att ha placeringsort på något av våra IT-kontor.


Just nu bygger vi nästa generation av våra infrastrukturtjänster, där vi ytterligare ska öka automatiseringen och vidareutveckla vår privata molnlösning för att hantera flera kunder.


Vi erbjudermycket goda semestervillkor samt goda tjänstepensionsvillkor och förmåner för dig som är förälder. Vi är en stor IT-avdelning som erbjuder dig utvecklingsmöjligheter både på djupet och på bredden. Du kommer att få möjlighet till en flexibel arbetstid och en hybrid arbetsplats, det är en självklarhet för oss att du har balans mellan arbete och fritid. Tillsammans arbetar vi med framtidens tekniklösningar!


Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba med it hos oss och ta del av vad några av våra medarbetare berättar om sina jobb: Jobba med it hos oss

**Om dig**  

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.


I det här jobbet ska du:

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara kommunikativ, hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* kunna driva utvecklingsaktiviteter från start till mål enligt uppsatta processer och kriterier
* förstå vikten av att, samt kunna skapa relationer med andra team för att nå de uppsatta målen
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker och kunna ställa om vid förändringar
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* ha god kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift på svenska
* kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar


Du ska även ha:

* Relevant utbildning inom IT-infrastruktur
* Minst 10 års aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling och underhåll av stora lagringslösningar
* Flera års erfarenhet av NetApp ontap


Det är önskvärt att du har kunskap om en eller flera av följande, StorageGRID, S3 generellt, Commvault. Det är även önskvärt om du har jobbat med agila metoder.

**Bra att veta**  

Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.


En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.


På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.


När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.


Välkommen med din ansökan!


Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
