* **Strong functional knowledge of Sales and Distribution (SD) and Logistics Execution (LE) modules, including configuration and troubleshooting.**
* **EDI knowledge – Hands-on experience with Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) integration, mapping, and troubleshooting transactions with customers and suppliers.**
* **E-Commerce support Experience – Understanding of SAP’s role in B2B/B2C e-commerce platforms, order fulfillment, and inventory synchronization.**
* **SAP S/4HANA Knowledge (Preferred) – Experience in SAP S/4HANA migration or implementation is a plus.**
* **Process Improvement Mindset – Ability to analyze business needs, identify process gaps, and implement SAP solutions that enhance efficiency.**
* **Technical Skills – Familiarity with IDOCs, ABAP debugging, and middleware integrations is beneficial.**
* **Collaboration & Communication – Ability to work closely with cross-functional teams, business users, and external partners to drive successful SAP implementations and improvements.**
* **Problem-Solving Ability – A proactive approach to troubleshooting and resolving issues in a fast-paced environment.**
* **Excellent English skills, Swedish is optional**







* **Samsung is a dynamic company in a fast-moving industry with many opportunities to grow and develop! To enjoy working with us, you must appreciate tempo, change, and taking initiative.**

title: Integration Manager, Digital Solutions
description:
**Be visionary**
 Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
   

  

 We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Your Key Responsibilities**
**As An Integration Manager, You Will**
* Partner with global customers to scope, plan, and implement our enterprise solutions, system-to-system integrations and drive the customer onboarding process.
* Lead customer workshops, training sessions, and user acceptance testing to ensure successful implementations and long-term value creation.
* Collaborate with internal teams (Product Management, Sales, Support, and R&D) to deliver successful projects and ensure alignment with customer goals.
* Develop an in-depth understanding of customer needs, IT environments, and system requirements to set up effective integrations between our solutions and customer CMMS/EAM/ERP systems.
* Act as a technical integration expert, supporting sales efforts by providing technical insights during the sales cycle and customer visits.
* Build extensive expertise in sensor integration, data flows, and creating structures that maximize customer value.
* Work closely with product managers to refine our offerings and develop additional integration solutions and packages.
* Support cross-functional teams to improve documentation, support materials, training resources, and communication strategies.
* Create and maintain a network of experts on other CMMS/EAM systems, contributing to future product enhancements and customer projects.
* Benchmark competitive solutions and provide insights to product management for market-driven innovation.


**What We’re Looking For**
 To excel in this role, you’ll need:
   

  

* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering or a related field.
* Proven experience in setting up system-to-system integrations through APIs, system configurations, customizations, or middleware.
* Excellent technical skills in system integrations and data management, with a strong understanding of cloud hosting options (multi-tenant, single-tenant, and on-prem).
* A background in Software as a Service (SaaS) is highly desirable.
* Outstanding customer relationship management and communication skills, with the ability to present complex technical concepts clearly to all levels of an organization.
* Strong project management skills, ensuring efficient and professional customer implementation processes.
* Flexibility to travel internationally, accounting for 20-50% of your time.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, to communicate effectively within our global organization as well as our international customers and teams.


**Why Join Us at Teledyne FLIR?**
 As an Integration Manager, you’ll have the unique opportunity to shape the future of enterprise solutions by driving customer success and contributing to innovative product offerings. By collaborating closely with global customers, you’ll gain deep market insights while evolving and streamlining customer implementation processes for maximum efficiency.
   

  

**At Teledyne FLIR, You’ll**
* Develop your career with the world's leading company in thermal imaging and sensing technology.
* Play a pivotal role in building enterprise solutions that deliver success for both our customers and the company.
* Enjoy a dynamic work environment where our broad range of products and sensors come together to create impactful solutions.
* Thrive in a friendly, collaborative culture that emphasizes creativity, problem-solving, and teamwork.


 If you’re driven, structured, and passionate about creating exceptional customer experiences, we’d love to have you on our team!
   

  

**Interested?**
 If you liked what you just read, and believe you are the person that will make us better, do not hesitate to apply.
   

  

 The selection process is ongoing and we may select our final candidate before the advert expires.
   

  

 When applying, make it easy for yourself. Add a resume and fill out the required fields, no need to add anything else at this point.
   

  

 We accept applications in English
   

  

 (Non-US) This position requires access to export-controlled information or items (i.e. regulated technology or technical data per ITAR/EAR US regulations). Applicants must be eligible to apply for and obtain the appropriate export control license from the U.S. Departments of State or Commerce.
   

  

 Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.

title: Sales Director
description:
Apply now »
   

  

**Date:** 
 Mar 25, 2025
   

  

**Location:** 
 Sweden - Stockholm
   

  

**Company:** 
 Super Micro Computer
   

  

**Job Req ID: 24887**
**About Supermicro**
 Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are amongst the fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer many new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us to drive accelerated growth and technology-led innovation in the global marketplace.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The Sales Director is responsible for driving the overall go to market strategy for Supermicro. This includes building plans and programs that will drive business in new markets and new customer segments that leverage our channels, the existing and emerging strategic partnerships. The role will be involved in all aspects of building the strategies and execute in order to generate revenue. This individual must be very strong at working cross functionally at all levels of the organization.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**
 Job included but not limited to:
   

  

* Represent and sell the entire Supermicro portfolio of products and services to large enterprise customers.
* Establish a high level of personal credibility as a trusted advisor to key client executives.
* Research and understand the client's industry. Deeply understand client business strategies and challenges.
* Act as a trusted advisor to client leaders, aggressively shape deals early in the sales cycle. Advance opportunities that result in profitable revenue growth for Supermicro.
* Demonstrate in depth knowledge in aligning Supermicro capabilities to client business, IT priorities, and positioning relative to competitors.
* Build and execute an Account Business Plan (ABP) that includes both transactional and strategic initiatives to grow Supermicro's presence and share in the account.
* Actively drive ABP results through effective account management and reviews.
* Identify, nurture, and close new solution opportunities that result in substantial growth in Super micro share, revenues, and margin.
* Meet or exceed quarterly and annual revenue and margin quotas. Uses margin management techniques.
* Qualify and close large deals of moderate to high complexity and cross-GBU scope.
* Work with all levels of decision-makers in the client organization including the CEO.
* Participate in account investment decisions in pricing and resources.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience preferably in high tech industry
* Minimum 3-7 years of direct sales experience selling server and storage to enterprise and fortune-1000 companies preferred
* Strong communication skills across multiple disciplines, cultures and geographies
* Track record of building relationships with senior executives and decision makers
* Demonstrate ability in the following areas: pre-call planning, opportunity qualification and objection handling, call structure and control, time and territory management
* Experience entering, tracking and reporting data on lead activity
* Consistent track record of meeting of exceeding sales target
* Must have Microsoft Excel Knowledge
* Multi-task and time management skills are a must
* Proficient in English and additional language is a huge plus


**Salary Range**
**EEO Statement**
 Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.
   

  

**Job Segment:** 
 Cloud, Data Center, Manager, Technology, Management
   

  

 Apply now »

title: Content Creator
description:
*At Desenio Group, a Swedish e-commerce success story, we are passionate about interior decor and design! Our business idea is simple: on-trend, attractive wall decor should be available to everyone. Since our inception, we’ve experienced steady growth and can now boast web shops available in more than 35 countries, with new markets opening continuously. At Desenio and Poster Store, you’ll find a wide selection of posters and mounting solutions, such as poster hangers and clips - often inspired by Scandinavian style.*
 We are now looking for a Content Creator to join our team. As a Content Creator, you will produce digital content for our two brands, Desenio and Poster Store. You will be part of a creative and talented team, producing engaging, high-quality content across various platforms, ensuring our contents resonates with our brands. You will report to Head of Brand Studio.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Produce content across our website and channels, incl. social media and newsletters
* Edit and produce professional-quality videos and content, ensuring they align with brand standards and messaging.
* Utilize AI tools to enhance content creation, including automation of tasks, improving efficiency, and generating creative ideas.
* Produce ads in alignment with our Commercial team
* Support other departments and regions with design requests


**Who We Are Looking Or**
* Education within content creation
* Proven experience in content creation and video editing, 2-3 years experience
* Great knowledge in Adobe Creative Suite, After effects, Premiere Pro
* Excellent knowledge in English, both spoken and written
* Understanding of current trends and a genuine interest in interior design


 IT’S A PLUS IF YOU HAVE
   

  

* Experience using AI tools for content generation, editing, or automation
* Experience in Storyteq
* Experience working in an e-commerce


 AS A PERSON
   

  

 You are a team player with great organizational skills. You are ambitious, self-driven and always tries to find more efficient ways of working. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and to work with multiple projects.
   

  

 PRACTICAL DETAILS
   

  

 Start date: As soon as possible
   

  

 Extent: This is a full-time position, with an initial probation period of 6 months.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Södermalm.
   

  

 Send your application in English by answering the application form as well as attaching your CV and cover letter. Note! We do not accept applications through email.
   

  

**About Desenio Group**
 Desenio Group is a fast-growing design and e-commerce group with a simple business idea and purpose: making on-trend, affordable and attractive wall art available to everyone. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, we are Europe’s leading online store for art prints and frames, and we ship to more than 35 countries worldwide. Desenio Group’s bonds are listed on Frankfurt Stock Exchange Open Market Quotation Board. For more information, please visit deseniogroup.com

title: Technical Lead / Lösningsarkitekt
description:
**Om oss** 




  





 Valtech, som nyligen förvärvade Kin + Carta, är ett ledande digitalt transformationsföretag som strävar efter att skapa bättre sätt att uppleva världen. Med över 6,500 medarbetare på mer än 60 kontor globalt hjälper vi varumärken att frigöra värde i en snabbt digitaliserad värld. Vi samarbetar med några av världens mest framstående företag, likaväl som lokala aktörer på den svenska marknaden och fokuserar på att utveckla innovativa lösningar som förbättrar både kundupplevelser och affärsprocesser.
 



  





**Rollen** 




  





 Vi söker en
 **Tech Lead / Solution Architect** 
 som har djup teknisk expertis och erfarenhet inom plattformsimplementering, särskilt med verktyg som
 **Optimizely** 
 . Du kommer att arbeta nära våra kunder och interna team för att designa, implementera och optimera digitala lösningar. Du bör vara baserad i Stockholm och kunna arbeta från vårt kontor 2–3 dagar per vecka.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




  




* Leda och delta i kundprojekt från förförsäljning och upptäckt till leverans, i samarbete med både lokala och globala team.
* Engagera både IT- och affärsintressenter för att skräddarsy lösningar som skapar affärsnytta.
* Designa och implementera skalbara och hållbara lösningar för CMS-projekt.
* Leda tvärfunktionella team för att integrera komplexa backend-system, inklusive CMS och externa tjänster.
* Bidra med tekniskt ledarskap och mentorskap för utvecklingsteam, samt främja en kultur av innovation och kvalitet.
* Aktivt identifiera och åtgärda tekniska utmaningar och flaskhalsar för att säkerställa optimal prestanda och effektivitet.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom digital transformation.



  





**Din Bakgrund** 




  




* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av backend-utveckling, med särskilt fokus på Optimizely CMS. Erfarenhet av eCommerce-plattformar är ett plus.
* Goda kunskaper inom .NET / .NET Core (C#), API-driven utveckling samt Privacy by Design.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar, främst Azure, och god förståelse för DevOps-principer.
* Erfarenhet av databasdesign och utveckling (inklusive SQL).
* Du är van vid att hantera kundrelationer och identifiera ytterligare sätt för att skapa värde genom tekniska lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att leda och designa arkitekturen för företagslösningar.



  





**Vad kan du förvänta dig hos oss?** 




  





 På Valtech kommer du att bli en del av ett kreativt och innovativt team som strävar efter att göra skillnad genom våra lösningar. Vi ger dig möjlighet att ta stort ansvar, vara en nyckelperson i vårt globala team och leda förändring. Vi värdesätter innovation, samarbete och frihet under ansvar. Hos oss får du kontinuerliga möjligheter att utvecklas och bidra till den globala tekniska utvecklingen.
 



  





**Är du redo att ta nästa steg?** 




  





 Vi söker en driven och engagerad person som vill vara med och forma framtidens digitala lösningar. Om detta låter som en spännande möjlighet för dig, ansök idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bidra till vår resa.
 



  





**Välkommen till Valtech!**

title: Data Architect for Production Core Unit, Solna/Hybrid
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Are you passionate about driving change? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can shape the future of logistics and how parcels are delivered – both physically and from an information perspective? Look no further! PostNord, the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions in the Nordic region, is searching a talented Data Architect to join our ongoing transformation journey.
   

  

 Join us
   

  

 Postnord is undergoing a large transformation within the Production domain to modernize and harmonize our IT across the Nordics. We are leaving a monolith-centric past and entering into a streaming and microservice based future in the cloud.
   

  

 As a Data Architect in the Production Core unit, you will be in the heart of production, creating data structures and information flows that impact how systems interact and collaborate. You will be working from operational all the way to strategic level. In collaboration with others, you will be taking decisions with immediate implications on agile development team’s backlogs.
   

  

**Job Duties**
 Central to PostNord’s new architecture, is a streaming based platform where all messages are controlled by a schema registry. The schemas essentially decide what information is being exchanged between sub-domains. The underlying data model is under development and will continue to evolve. To be effective, the model must cater for business needs while at the same time being lean and straight forward.
   

  

 The Data Architect will work closely with other architects on different levels, development teams, and also with the business – to evolve the data model and design services tightly coupled with it. You will ensure that agreed on company-wide architecture principles and guidelines are followed, while also innovating and challenging status quo. In this role, you will be in a good position to play an important role in our ongoing tech-transformation and future success!
   

  

 ,
   

  

 We are looking for you who have
   

  

**Need-to-have**
* Experience in working with information and data architecture including documenting current data flows and creating a wanted state to work towards
* Experience in transaction intensive IT Products
* Experience in driving organizational tech-transformations
* Experience in building event driven architectures on a large enterprise scale
* Strong integrity and analysis skills
* Urge to understand and model business needs
* Drive for obtaining modern and effective information handling
* Understanding of the importance of weighing both functional and non-functional requirements


**Nice-to-have**
* Experience in the logistics or supply chain industry.
* Experience in building Micro-Service based architecture
* Experience in Apache Kafka technology and real-time streaming
* Fluency in Swedish


**Knowledge requirement**
* Civil Engineering, bachelor’s degree in computer science (as a minimum), or equivalent
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.


 We offer you
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer a variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


 We make everyday life easier
   

  

 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com
   

  

 Apply
   

  

 We look forward to receive your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns, please contact manager Carolina Lunde on carolina.lunde@postnord.com
   

  

 Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga
   

  

 We are looking forward to hear from you!

title: Section Manager Associated Business
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fueled by dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

 We are now looking for a new colleague to join Nissan's eNEST business division (Belgium, Denmark, Luxemburg, Netherlands, Norway, Sweden).
   

  

**How can you contribute and have an impact?**
* Deploy associated business sales strategy and product
* Manage the Nissan More warranty program
* Reach associated business products penetration objective
* Manage new Nissan associated business products
* Manage associated business sales forecasts
* Supply Market surveys and benchmarking activities to AMIEO for any local associated business products
* Support any time AMIEO Aftersales associated business requirements
* Collaborate with the relevant AMIEO Department to create promotional materials and campaigns
* Analyze market trends and customer feedback to identify new associated business sales opportunities
* Provide training and support to dealership staff on associated business sales products
* Manage Loyalty Roadside Assistance (LRSA)
* Manage Nissan insurance products
* Monitor and report on associated business sales performance and customer satisfaction metrics.
* Associated Business local system management
* Ensure compliance with Nissan's quality standards and policies


**What are we looking for:**
* Other tasks assigned by the Manager
* Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field
* Minimum of 5-10 years of experience in business management or marketing, preferably in the automotive industry or insurance
* Knowledge of Nissan's product line and brand values
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team


 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Amsterdam Netherlands

title: SAP Finance Management consultant
description:
*We are now building for the future!* 
*Are you a professional with experience in SAP and project management looking to play an active and important role of defining and shaping the future of our SAP practice? With us you will have the chance to work as a trusted advisor to executive level for our key and growth accounts. Warmly welcome to join our journey in a global context/network!*
**About Us**
 Our high-performance SAP team consist of experienced management consultants with expertise in both business and technology. With a strong Nordic presence and close collaboration with our Global SAP teams, with more than 6,000 SAP professionals, we have a world-class capability.
   

  

 In Sweden we are on a growth journey with a client portfolio which includes leaders in several different industries, including both national and multinational companies. Together with SAP, we collaborate on delivering major IT & business transformations for our clients in collaboration with CXO-level.
   

  

 Many of our clients are undergoing major strategic changes, e.g. establishing new business models or reviewing the resilience of their business or transforming to become truly customer-oriented. They also need to take steps in their digitalization journey to enable move to cloud, use innovations such as AI, be sustainable and compliant with the future we are already in. Our role is to guide the client to execute their strategic choices into action. This often involves assessing value of different options, establishing new operating models, recommending how to proceed with new technology or how to re-design a supply chain or an organization to fit the new needs.
   

  

 KPMG offers services in a diverse range of areas, equipping us with the skillsets needed to deliver on large, cross-functional SAP transformations. We are working with both top- and bottom-line improvements for our clients, with support of a broad range of domestic and international experts and frameworks – as well as the capability to be innovative.
   

  

 As a
 **SAP Finance** 
**Management Consultant** 
 in our team you will work in large programs all the way from pre study to implementation. You will advice the client and project team in SAP Finance related topics to ensure the clients get the maximum value from their SAP investment and support them on the road towards a modern Finance organization (based on Future of Finance), ensure the project team and client understands and get the benefits out of innovations in relations to SAP Finance, bridge the gap between Business and technology in our large SAP programs and ensure the program delivers high quality deliverables and advice connected to SAP Finance.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**We are looking for** 
 high performing and professionals who can combine classical management consulting with modern applications and technology. We believe you have some experience from SAP and are well aligned with the future of SAP. This includes transformations towards SAP S/4HANA, the cloud shift through private edition (RISE) and public edition (GROW) as well as innovations available by SAP.
   

  

* You may have experience from SAP Finance S/4HANA implementations,
* You may have experience from and interested in working with the largest Swedish global companies,
* You have understanding for the connection between the business value and accurate implementation and improvements in the SAP Finance area.
* You can understand and translate client’s needs into effective solutions.
* You are curious personality and have the ability to stay up to date with the latest and greatest within the SAP Finance area,
* You are collaborative personality and strive in seeing team members to succeed and develop our SAP practice,
* You have a relevant academic background (e.g., business and/or engineering)
* You are fluent in English, both spoken and written.


**Our offer**
* An exciting opportunity to work with our clients in their SAP transformations towards S/4 HANA, cloud mindset and innovation.
* An inspiring work environment where you are empowered to perform at your best
* Engaged colleagues collaborating cross functional, both locally but also internationally
* Where we learn from each other and accelerating your growth and development
* A flexible workplace
* Personal development, we believe in the individual's drive
* A global workplace with a network of superstars


**Want to make a difference with us?**
 Don’t wait with your application as we review applications and are hiring on a rolling basis.
   

  

 For any questions related to the recruitment process please contact Talent Partner, Lasma Indrijaite lindrijaite@kpmg.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application and for new colleagues to join our team!**

title: Systemspecialist inom vårdsystem till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
description:
Karolinskas IT-avdelning växer och vi söker fler som vill vara med och utveckla framtidens vårdsystem. Vi söker dig som tänker innovativt och vågar utmana. Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med att konfigurera och anpassa system som stödjer viktiga områden som Perioperativ vård, Medicin, Intensivvård och Sterilteknik, och därmed vara med och forma framtidens hälso- och sjukvård.
   

  

**Du erbjuds**
* möjlighet att arbeta i en innovativ och snabbt utvecklande miljö med direkt påverkan på vården
* chansen att arbeta nära vårdens professioner och bidra till utveckling av system som verkligen gör skillnad
* en arbetsplats där du ständigt får möjlighet att lära och växa genom nya utmaningar
* ett engagerat team och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter inom en av Europas ledande sjukvårdsorganisationer


 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är ett av Europas största universitetssjukhus med ca 15 000 medarbetare. Sjukhuset är ledande inom den medicinska utvecklingen i Sverige och internationellt och vi rankas bland världens främsta sjukhus.
   

  

 Karolinska Universitetssjukhusets uppdrag är att bedriva specialiserad och högspecialiserad sjukvård. Vår vision ”Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag” är vägledande när vi arbetar mot tydliga värden för patienter och samhälle och mot medicinska framsteg.
   

  

 I avdelning Hälsoinformatik och vårdsystem ansvarar vi för IT-lösningar som vården är helt beroende av i sitt dagliga arbete. Vi strävar efter att ge vården bästa möjliga IT-stöd genom att förenkla och att skapa lösningar där det krävs manuellt arbete idag. Systemen förvaltas idag av en mindre grupp, placerad inom IT på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset i Solna.
   

  

 Leveransteamet Ansvarar För Ett Definierat Område Som Innehåller Ett Antal IT-system Med Fokus På Att Stödja Anestesi, Operation Och Sterilteknik För Vuxna Och Barn. Teamet Hanterar Både Utveckling Av Nya Lösningar Och Förvaltning Av Existerande Lösningar. Du Kommer Jobba Nära Vårdens Professioner Och i Ett Sammanhang Som Rör Sig Snabbt Och Med Stor Variation. Vårdens Lagrum Är Grundläggande Och i Relationen Till Dessa Kommer Du Som Systemspecialist Leda Eller Arbeta Med
   

  

* framtagande av nya tjänster/funktioner genom att konfigurera och anpassa våra lösningar
* systemintegrationer
* livscykelhantering


**Du Kommer Även Att**
* genomföra utbildning för användare
* hantera incidenter och problem
* ta fram och uppdatera dokumentation samt utbildningsmaterial


**Vi söker dig som**
* trivs med att arbeta självständigt samtidigt som du har ett nära samarbete med dina kollegor
* gillar att vara där det händer och har en naturlig nyfikenhet för att söka ny kunskap
* är metodiskt driven, har vana att arbeta systematisk och tycker om att lära dig nytt
* har en god förmåga att kommunicera med personer som har teknisk bakgrund respektive vårdbakgrund.


 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Erfarenhet av arbete med systemstöd som används inom den perioperativa medicinska och intensivvård
* Relevant utbildning för uppdraget
* Förmåga att uttrycka dig muntligt och skriftligt både på svenska och engelska.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av systemutvecklingsprocessen som inkluderar analys, design, konfiguration/utveckling och test av lösningar (gärna på ett iterativt och agilt sätt).
* Erfarenhet av att ha jobbat kliniskt inom anestesi och intensivvård.
* Erfarenhet från arbete där du har omsatta vårdens behov till IT


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 I samband med din ansökan behöver du bifoga CV. Istället för ett personligt brev ber vi dig besvara urvalsfrågor samt kort motivera varför du passar för rollen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!
   

  

 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
   

  

 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
   

  

 För tillsvidaretjänster kan provanställning komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

**Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm**
 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
   

  

 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
   

  

 Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Fackliga representanter
   

  

 Namn
   

  

 SACO
   

  

 Telefon
   

  

 saco.karolinska.karolinska@regionstockholm.se
   

  

 Namn
   

  

 Vision
   

  

 Telefon
   

  

 vision.karolinska@regionstockholm.se

title: Finance & Commercial Lead
description:
Pocketlaw is seeking a visionary Finance & Commercial Lead to help shape our future success. In our high-growth journey, we're looking for an exceptional talent who brings ambition, analytical prowess, and dynamic energy to drive both financial excellence and operational innovation. This role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact across our organization as we scale to new heights.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The Finance & Commercial Lead will be responsible for managing the company's finances while optimising its operational and commercial processes. This dual role requires strong analytical skills, excellent strategic thinking, and hands-on leadership to ensure both financial stability and operational excellence.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Financial Management**
* Oversee all financial operations including budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting
* Oversee cash flow, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and banking relationships
* Prepare and analyse monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and reporting
* Lead financial planning and analysis to support strategic decision-making
* Develop and implement financial policies and procedures
* Coordinate with external auditors and tax professionals


**Commercial Management**
* Lead special projects related to commercial and growth initiatives, e.g. data-driven analyses to optimise pipeline generation, streamline sales or customer upsell processes
* Simplify, streamline and optimise business processes across other departments
* Implement and maintain operational systems, policies, and procedures
* Manage vendor relationships and contracts


**Leadership & Strategy**
* Provide financial insights to inform business strategy and identify growth opportunities
* Develop and track KPIs for measuring operational and financial performance
* Build and lead the finance and operations teams
* Serve as a key member of the leadership team
* Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards


**Qualifications**
**Required Skills & Experience**
* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field (MBA or relevant master's degree preferred)
* 5+ years of experience in financial management, management consulting, or other commercial strategy
* Strong understanding of financial principles, budgeting, and forecasting
* Excellent analytical, data-driven and problem-solving abilities
* Experience with financial software and ERP systems
* Outstanding leadership and communication skills
* Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
* Fluency in Swedish and English


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience of scaling finance, operations or commercials at a growth-stage company


**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary and warrants program
* Steep professional development opportunities
* Opportunity to make a significant impact in a fast-paced, growing organisation
* International, innovative and collaborative work environment
* Vibrant office in the heart of Stockholm


**About Pocketlaw**
 Pocketlaw is a rapidly growing AI legal tech company, reimagining legal work for every team. We enable companies to centralise their legal processes and automate contract management through intuitive tools, automation and AI. Headquarter in Stockholm, and an office in London.
   

  

 Pocketlaw is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
   

  

 Pocketlaw helps companies solve their everyday legal needs - empowering every team in the organisation to create contracts and manage legal with efficiency, ease and confidence. Pocketlaw is transforming legal for businesses; turning it from a business blocker into a business enabler - with the end goal of giving every company in the world legal peace of mind.

title: Engagement Manager inom ServiceNow
description:
Hos oss blir du en del av ett innovativt och dynamiskt företag där du får leda projekt inom allt från Field Service Management och Workplace Service Delivery till IT Operations Management och Operational Technology. Du kommer att få leda komplexa ServiceNow-implementationer och säkerställa att våra kunders behov blir till framgångsrika lösningar.
   

  

 Våra kunder är både nationella och internationella, vilket vilket möjliggör för dig att utvecklas i en global miljö.
   

  

 Engagement Manager på Advania🚀
   

  

 Som
 **Engagement** 
**Manager** 
 ansvarar du för att leda och samordna våra ServiceNow-projekt. Du är den primära kontaktpersonen för våra kunder och ser till att affärsbehov och tekniska lösningar harmoniseras för att leverera högsta kvalitet.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

  

* Leda projekt från start till mål och säkerställa att leveranser sker enligt plan och överträffar kundens förväntningar.
* Bygga starka och långvariga relationer med våra kunder, samtidigt som du fungerar som en strategisk rådgivare inom ServiceNow.
* Samarbeta med interna team av utvecklare, lösningsarkitekter och projektledare för att säkerställa att alla parter har samma målbild och arbetar mot gemensamma framgångar.
* Säkerställa att alla projekt drivs enligt agila metoder och bästa praxis inom ServiceNow.
* Ständigt arbeta för att identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter hos befintliga kunder och driva tillväxt.


 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 Du kommer med flera års erfarenhet av projektledning inom IT, varav två år inom ServiceNow. Din förmåga att bygga starka kundrelationer och leda kundprojekt har gett dig erfarenhet att arbeta enligt agila metoder i flera parallella projekt. Vi ser även att du har:
   

  

  

* Erfarenhet av implementationsprojekt inom ServiceNow är en bonus.
* En god förståelse för ServiceNow-plattformens kapacitet och förmågan att översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar.
* Certifieringar inom ServiceNow (t.ex. CSA, CAD eller liknande) är meriterande.
* Stark kommunikations- och ledarskapsförmåga, både på svenska och engelska.


 Vad vi erbjuder:
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du får leda projekt som verkligen gör skillnad för våra kunder. Till ditt stöd har du engagerade och motiverade medarbetare som tillsammans med dig vill fortsätta utforska och arbeta med med marknadsledande teknologier inom ServiceNow. Du kommer även få ta del av:
   

  

  

* Kontinuerlig utveckling och certifieringsmöjligheter inom ServiceNow.
* En företagskultur som värdesätter teamwork, innovation och balans mellan arbete och fritid.
* Möjlighet att arbeta i en internationell miljö med kunder och kollegor från hela världen


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut.
   

  

 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.
   

  

 Advania Sverige, ”The tech company with people at heart”, har kontor över hela landet, från Luleå i norr till Malmö i syd. Dagligen hjälper våra 1 700 specialister våra kunder, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, i deras ambitioner och mål att digitalisera sina verksamheter. Genom långsiktiga relationer, ledande teknologier, moderna plattformslösningar och strategiska partnerskap formar vi framtidens IT-landskap. Vårt syfte sträcker sig bortom teknik: att ge människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden.
   

  

 Advaniagruppen levererar tjänster till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Storbritannien, Island, Finland och Danmark inom hållbar och säker digitalisering.

title: Change Management Consultant
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and Manufacturing
description:
**Are you currently working as a Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) consultant or specialist and looking to transition into Organizational Change Management?** 




  





 Do you have a passion for how elevating Product Lifecycle Management can enable the green transition and reduce environmental impact? Perhaps you are already involved in Business Transformation within PLM programs and are seeking new, exciting opportunities in large multinational manufacturing companies. We are now seeking a
 **Change Management Consultant - Product Lifecycle Management** 
 to join our team.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Change Management Consultant, you will act as a Change Manager within our client projects, taking responsibility for the entire Change Journey. Starting with understanding the need for change and its drivers, to leading implementation all the way to behavior change. You will collaborate closely with the technical team to define the transition from the current state ("as-is") to the desired future state ("to-be"). Hence, a strong understanding of Product Lifecycle Management is essential for success in this role.
 



  





**The Right Candidate** 




 We believe you have a solid understanding of
 **Product Lifecycle Management** 
 , including
 **Portfolio Planning, Requirements Management, Design, Industrialization, Manufacturing, Use,** 
 and
 **End of Life** 
 . You are familiar with at least one PLM software solution and understand how to create a
 **digital thread** 
 of Product Lifecycle Information.
 



 If you are passionate about PLM and looking to transition from a technical role into Organizational Change Management, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.
 



  





**Your main responsibilities will be:** 



* Conducting Current & Desired State Analysis
* Performing Stakeholder Analysis
* Assessing Impacts
* Developing and executing Communication Plans
* Coordinating and delivering Training Programs
* Driving Behavior Change initiatives
* Measuring progress using ADKAR methodology



  





**We believe that your are:** 



* A relationship builder
* Eager to learn new things everyday
* Humble
* Analytical
* Proactive
* Structured



  





**We also believe that you have:** 



* A bachelor’s degree (or higher) in engineering
* Experience in the manufacturing industry
* Several years of experience as a PLM Consultant or equivalent role
* A solid understanding of IT project management
* Excellent English skills, both written and verbal
* Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex topics clearly and concisely (both orally and in PowerPoint)
* Proven leadership skills and the ability to inspire and guide people
* Prosci Certification is an advantage



  





 We are building a strong foundation for NewCore, this is why every new team member is extremely important to us. Given that you have a strong foundation in the required skills and characteristics, we believe that you can hit the ground running together with our clients on complex projects, but in the end, we hire personalities and not CVs.
 



  





**A few fun facts:** 




 This is a full-time position based in your preferred location in Sweden. You will be hired as a Change Management Consultant and operate as a Change Manager in our client projects. Most of the NewCore team is based in Stockholm, you will be finding us at Norrsken House on Birger Jarlsgatan at least once a week.
 



  





 If you are not based in Stockholm, you will travel to our beautiful capital a couple of times every month. This position may require some travels to our clients who are based all over Sweden. Some trips abroad may occur depending on the clients’ demands.
 



  





 NewCore is growing at a fast pace, our first team member was hired in March 2022, and we are now a great multi-cultural team with employees with roots in India, Lithuania, France, Costa Rica, Sweden and more. We have experience in a broad spectrum of business areas, such as, Product Lifecycle Management, Servitization, Change management, Communication and Circular economy.
 



  





 We work in a fun, fast paced and hybrid environment where work-life balance, autonomy and personal growth is key.
 



  





 We take pride in having very competitive benefits and a recruitment process where we focus on your characteristics and your competence and not your CV.
 



  





 If you are interested in learning more about our recruitment process, please visit or career page Join us at NewCore — NewCore Business
 



  





**If you are eager to make a difference by combining your expertise in PLM with Change Management, we’d love to hear from you!**

title: Customer Onboarding Manager
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 With over 300 million users and Customers worldwide, we are growing fast and continuously evolving how we support our Customers. As part of strengthening our Customer value and ensuring they achieve long-term success using Mentimeter, we are now hiring a Strategic and Experienced Onboarding Manager to join our Customer Experience team within Sales.
   

  

 This role is both operational and strategic—while you will be deeply involved in onboarding Enterprise Customers, we also need you to help shape the vision and framework for a world-class premium onboarding experience that can scale as we grow.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As an Onboarding Manager, we want you to take our Onboarding to the next level, by using past experiences and applying a strong vision on how to achieve Onboarding excellence at Mentimeter.
 **You will work closely with a rolling book of selected Enterprise Customers to ensure a successful Onboarding and lay the foundation for future retention and long term growth.** 
 You will also project lead our global onboarding process and manage global routing of all new Customers coming in.
   

  

*Your main focus areas*
**Strategic onboarding leadership**
* Own, refine, and improve our onboarding process for our Enterprise Customers, ensuring we set our Customers off to a strong start in using our tool (adoption and usage) with the aim to drive future retention and expansion.


**Impactful Customer engagement**
* Work directly with our Customers to ensure they get value from Mentimeter already from the start, accelerating their time-to-value and securing long-term engagement. While we have initially focused on our High Potential (HiPo) Customer segment, we are exploring expansion into our Strategic Customer segment in 2025. This role will be key in shaping that evolution.


**Project leader for the global onboarding process**
* Drive the team adoption of a structured and scalable onboarding approach, ensuring team alignment and continuous optimization for efficiency, impact and an improved Customer experience.


**Global Customer routing**
* Manage the Customer routing process globally, ensuring a smooth and successful handover from Customer acquisition to Customer success, within our set timeframes.


*Key Responsibilities*
* Drive onboarding for selected Enterprise Customers, ensuring a smooth rollout and maximizing adoption.
+ Lead onboarding workshops, webinars and training to accelerate adoption and demonstrate Mentimeter’s value.
+ Support technical implementations (SCIM, SSO, integrations) to remove barriers to usage.
+ Monitor onboarding KPIs and Customer engagement data, identifying trends and implementing improvements.

* Continue to develop, refine and scale our onboarding process, bringing best-in-class methodologies and automation to improve efficiency.
* Responsible for ensuring that all our Customers, globally, are taken through our Onboarding Journey with appropriate actions from the Customer Success team, within desired timelines.
* Global Routing of all New Customers to the Customer Success team.
* Ensure we have an efficient Customer Routing Process that is scalable, automized and fair.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Customer Acquisition, Customer Success, Product and Marketing, to ensure a seamless Customer experience.


**What You’ll Get**
**A Change to Have Impact**
* Be part of a fast-growing global company shaping the future of meetings & presentations.
* Own and influence how we onboard Customers, with the freedom to innovate.
* Work cross-functionally in a dynamic, fun, and supportive team.


**Best-in-Class Tools & Support**
* To be able to deliver a great and unforgettable Customer experience, you will work closely with all parts of Mentimeter (Product, Marketing and Sales). Most closely, you will partner up with our Customer Success Team, who are all working with our existing Enterprise Customers, helping them become successful in using Mentimeter.
* You will also have Sales Operations, Sales Engineers and our CRM and data gathering systems to support you (Planhat, Salesforce, Intercom, Looker, Sales Navigator, Salesloft)


**Exciting Growth & Career Paths**
 We aim to promote from within - we want to grow the next generation of sales leaders and experts. Ten years from now, we hope to look back together and reflect on this as a transformative time in our careers.
   

  

* Choose your path:
+ Sales Expert → We develop world-class individual contributors. Whether you aim to become a Senior Onboarding or Customer Success Manager, a Strategic Sales professional, or a future SaaS leader, we’ll help you master your craft.
+ Sales Leadership → If leading and coaching others is your goal, we’ll support you in growing into a Team Lead or Manager role.


**Who You Are**
**Must haves for the role**
* 5+ years experience in Customer Success and Onboarding, within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.
* Experience from onboarding Enterprise Customers, including working with senior stakeholders
* Experience from setting up and establishing and/or refining an onboarding journey, being part in driving strategic initiatives and ways of working that were implemented across the team/org.
* Strategic mindset – ability to both execute and shape the bigger picture.
* Strong Project management skills – process-driven, structured, and detail-oriented with ability to take something from start to finish. .
* Ability to handle multiple priorities and drive initiatives forward independently.
* Data-driven approach – ability to track, analyze, and optimize onboarding impact.
* Comfortable with technical setups (SCIM, SSO, integrations).
* Strong communicator & relationship-builder
* Creative problem solver
* Curious, good listener and responsive to others needs
* You are required to have professional level English (we operate in 100+ markets)


**Nice to have**
* Previous experience in designing and scaling onboarding processes.
* Knowledge of automation and workflow optimization in Customer onboarding
* Additional languages beyond English (Swedish is not required)
* Bachelor or masters degree (field not important)


**Ready to Join?**
 Mentimeter is growing fast, and this is your chance to be part of something special. If you want to impact the way our Enterprise Customers start their Menti journey, set a solid foundation for long-term Customer retention and take ownership of your own success, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 Apply now and let’s build something great together!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Product Owner, Core Platform
description:
**About Us**
 For us, going to work every day has an even greater purpose than putting the latest product or technology on the market. It’s about improving the everyday lives of millions. By staying humble and open to new ideas, we can push the boundaries for cooking, cleaning, and well-being at home. But to keep doing so, we need more people who want to innovate and reimagine what life at home can be.
   

  

 For that, we employ great people from a wide variety of backgrounds – not just because it’s the right thing to do, but also because we believe that diverse perspectives make our business stronger and more innovative. If you share our values, come find your place in our global community. Meet us on @lifeatelectrolux and career.electroluxgroup.com to learn more
   

  

**About The Organization And Role**
 In this role, you will join the Consumer Direct Interaction - Experience Organization (CDI XO) which consists of two product domains: Digital Commerce and Digital Post Purchase with several Product Areas within.
   

  

 We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Product Owner (TPO) to join the Digital post-purchase domain.
   

  

 The ideal candidate should have a strong technical background and excellent communication skills. In this role, you will be part of a cross-domain team responsible for developing the core platform that will be supporting both Digital Commerce and Post Purchase. You will work closely with the other Product Owners and the Product Manager for the area to define the strategy and roadmap while working daily with the engineering team to lead the development and rollout activities.
   

  

 The Core Platform team will be responsible for consumer registration, product registration, service booking, Data as a Product (ODL), Order lifecycle management, Subscription & Payments, Side by Side extension, and messaging.
   

  

**Why Join Us?** 

* Innovative Environment: Opportunity to work with talented teams developing cutting-edge backend services and microservices.
* Strategic Role: Be a key player in bridging the gap between technical excellence and business needs.
* Dynamic Work Environment: Collaborate in a dynamic, fast-paced environment that values innovation and efficiency.


**Key Responsibilities**
**Project Management & Technical Liaison:**
* API & Data Project Execution: Plan and manage the backlog for API, microservices, ETL, and system integration projects, ensuring timely delivery.
* Stakeholder Alignment & Scope Definition: Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables, balancing technical feasibility with business needs.
* Technical Communication & Translation: Act as the primary point of contact, translating technical complexities into clear, actionable information for non-technical stakeholders.
* Technical Guidance & Road Mapping: Provide technical insights and develop project roadmaps and documentation.
* Process Optimization & Best Practices: Identify and implement process improvements and ensure adherence to best practices for documentation, tracking, and prioritization.
* Workflow Improvement: Identify and resolve bottlenecks in communication and workflows between technical and non-technical teams.


**Qualifications:**
* Development & Product Experience: 5-8 years of professional experience with a strong focus on coding and digital product development.
* Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a closely related discipline.
* Core Technical Skills: In-depth understanding of backend development, API design, microservices architecture, and ETL processes.
* Technical Landscape: Familiarity with legacy systems, major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), and contemporary development frameworks.
* Project Leadership: Demonstrated ability to manage technical projects or programs, including utilizing Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban).
* Project Management Tools: Proficiency in project management tools such as Jira, Asana, and Trello.
* Preferred Skills: Hands-on coding experience, and familiarity with DevOps practices and cloud infrastructure (CI/CD pipelines).


**Where you'll be:** 
  

  

 This is a full-time position, based at our Electrolux Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:** 
  

  

* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment.
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family-friendly benefits
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.


**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**

title: Sales Executive Finland
description:
Are you prepared for a change? Do you want to make the world a safer place? Join us in Finland as a Sales Executive focused on technical solutions and service excellence.
   

  

 We at ID North, are a leader in identity security solutions (IAM, IGA, PAM) in the Nordics. We want to extend our reach on the Nordic market and therefore seek for a Sales Executive in Finland to join our journey of growth and innovation and work with customers to develop tomorrow's identity security solutions.
   

  

 Your Role and Responsibilities 📌
   

  

 In the role of Sales Executive, you will:
   

  

* Generate and maintain strong relationships with potential clients and partners within the tech industry, focusing on identity security solutions, and bringing value to customers.
* Understand and articulate advanced technical solutions based on client needs and regulatory requirements.
* Deliver compelling presentations and demonstrations of our products, services, and technical concepts.
* Collaborate with technical teams to develop and execute strategic account plans, leading to successful sales engagements.
* Leverage technical expertise to provide input on product development, ensuring market needs are met with precision and innovation.


 Some travel within the Nordics may be required, as we have offices in Stockholm, Borås, Gothenburg, Denmark, and Helsinki. And potential customers nationally all over Finland.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience 📓**
 We are looking for individuals with:
   

  

* A strong technical background, ideally within IT solutions or identity security.
* Proven sales experience, particularly in high-tech or SaaS environments.
* The capability to understand complex technical information and relay it clearly to customers and stakeholders.
* Experience working with identity security solutions is highly valued.
* Fluency in both Finish and English, especially Swedish, in both written and spoken forms. Knowledge of additional languages is an advantage.


 Attributes and Personality Traits ⭐️
   

  

 Your success in this role relies on:
   

  

* Being a solution-oriented individual with a passion for learning and self-development.
* Strong interpersonal skills to build relationships with clients and work collaboratively within our team.
* The ability to listen actively and communicate clearly, demonstrating understanding and empathy.
* A motivation to achieve and exceed sales targets through technical expertise and market awareness.


 What We Offer 🚀
   

  

 At ID North, you will join a thriving and supportive company at the forefront of identity security. You will have opportunities to grow alongside industry specialists every day. We offer competitive benefits and you will play a crucial role in our continued success and delivery. We cherish our collaborative culture, taking time to travel, embark on adventures and enjoy our journey to the top together.
   

  

 If this sounds like a position for you, we have immediate needs. Don’t hesitate to apply or send your application. Are you IN?
   

  

 Welcome – Chief Human Resources Officer Linda Öhlin

title: Analytiker bedrägeri till Folksam
description:
Till sektionen Bedrägeri och Utredning söker vi nu en Analytiker bedrägeri. Sektionen är ny och kommer att ta ett helhetsansvar för anti-bedrägeri (förebygga, identifiera, utreda) inom Folksams sakförsäkringsverksamhet. I denna roll ges möjligheten att vara med att ta Folksams förmåga inom anti-bedrägeri till nästa nivå. Här får du ett unikt tillfälle till att delta från start och att vara med och bygga upp denna verksamhet från grunden. Du bidrar till att skapa en tryggare och mer ekonomiskt fördelaktig framtid för bolagets 4 miljoner kunder – i den här rollen kan du göra skillnad varje dag!
 



  





 För dig som söker en arbetsplats som präglas av professionalism, ett stort engagemang och en verkligt god kollegial stämning, är Folksam helt rätt som bolag!
 



  





**Är detta din nya utmaning?** 




 Rollen som Analytiker bedrägeri är, liksom sektionen Bedrägeri och Utredning, nyinrättad och är en del av en större satsning på att stärka anti-bedrägeriförmågan på Folksam. Sektionen tillhör enheten Skador som ansvarar för hantering av samtliga försäkringsrelaterade skadeärenden, vilket 2023 var över 1,1 miljoner ärenden. Sektionen har flera ben, såsom strategi, analys, och utredning. Inledningsvis består sektionen av cirka 30 medarbetare.
 



  





 Ditt uppdrag som analytiker är att designa och underhålla modeller för att analysera bedrägerier med syfte att motverka och identifiera sådana. Du arbetar nära affärsutvecklare, utredare och övriga analysfunktioner inom Skador. Du förser verksamheten med relevanta analyser och insikter. Du kommer ges möjlighet att sätta stor egen prägel på utformningen av rollen. Här ges du en unik möjlighet till att med din utforskande och kreativa kapacitet bidra på en spännande och för bolaget viktig utvecklingsresa. Du får chansen att tillsammans med dina kollegor bidra till något större – något med verklig betydelse. Du blir en del av ett dynamiskt samarbete där många perspektiv möts och skapar värde.
 



  





 Du rapporterar till sektionschefen för Bedrägeri och Utredning och kommer att ha kontaktytor mot många olika delar av Folksamgruppen. Föredragen placeringsort är Stockholm, men placering på något av Folksams andra kontor kan vara möjligt.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 



* Utveckla och förfina modeller och analysregler kopplat till bedrägerier.
* Medverka till att det finns tillräckliga data och integrationer för bedrägerianalys.
* Stötta utveckling och införande av nya verktyg inom anti-bedrägeri.
* Analysera och identifiera mönster och trender kopplat till bedrägerier.



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har relevant högskoleutbildning inom till exempel statistik, matematik eller data. Alternativt har du motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet. Du har några års erfarenhet av analys och datamodellering och erfarenhet av att använda SQL, Databricks och/eller Python som analysverktyg. Du har erfarenhet av att driva eller delta i projekt relaterade till IT- och teknikimplementering. Tidigare erfarenhet av bedrägeriarbete är meriterande, gärna inom sakförsäkring. Du behärskar de svenska och engelska språken flytande i tal och skrift.
 



  





 Som person är du analytisk lagd med en förmåga att hantera komplexa problem. Du tar gärna initiativ, arbetar effektivt och har en vilja att nå framdrift. Du är nyfiken på att förstå affärens och mottagarnas behov och utvecklar därefter datadrivna lösningar som gör skillnad i verksamheten. Du är kommunikativ och trivs med att aktivt arbeta för ett bra samarbete med personer runtom i organisationen, i syfte att tillsammans uppnå bästa möjliga resultat.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Folksam med Prodiem. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, varför vi gärna vill ha din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Ansökan sker via Prodiems hemsida www.prodiem.se. Vid frågor kontaktar du Jessica Maurell på Prodiem, tfn 073-233 01 17 eller Caroline Björk på tfn, 073-303 34 66.
 



  





 Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Ann-Louise Andersson 070-831 61 44, Forena Mats Kjellgren 070-831 59 98 och Handels Mikael A Carlsson 070-831 51 32.
 



 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





*Folksamgruppen erbjuder försäkringar och långsiktigt sparande som skapar trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi är cirka 4 000 medarbetare och vår vision är att våra kunder ska känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld. Vi engagerar oss i det våra kunder bryr sig om och är måna om att de är rätt försäkrade.* 




  





*Folksam är ett kundägt företag med stort fokus på hållbarhetsfrågor. Vi har många roliga, utvecklande jobb och hos oss har du goda chanser till en spännande karriär med bra förmåner. Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Vi erbjuder flexibiliteten att varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån utifrån verksamhetens behov. Våra trevliga kontor runt om i landet ger mötesplatser för samarbete, lärande och en gemensam kultur – tillsammans skapar vi engagemang och kraft framåt!* 




  





*Läs mer om företaget på https://www.folksam.se*

title: ARAS PLM Solution Architect
description:
We’re looking for experienced ARAS PLM Solution Architects, who can bring value to the team and work as a key resource in our PLM projects. You will act as a creator of architectural design, defining system requirements and use cases to address overall business requirements, ensuring that the technical solution remains aligned and delivers value throughout any project. Location can be in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Helsingborg or Malmö.
   

  

**The role**
* Engage in customer Project Delivery Activities
* Analyze customer requirements and contribute to the configuration of PLM and other associated systems
* Conduct requirements gathering sessions and workshops
* Propose, plan, design and communicate architectural solutions with both Capgemini and Customers
* Produce written specifications that aligns with customer requirements for proposed solutions and configuration activities
* Identify issues and risks and provide input for solutions to key stakeholders
* Actively contribute to Pre-Sales Activities
* Development and presentation of custom solutions
* Participate in initial customer discovery
* Work with sales for budgetary proposals


**Your profile**
* University degree, preferably in the fields of Computer Science or Engineering
* Demonstrated expertise in developing and deploying solutions based on ARAS
* At least 4 years of experience working in a Nordic country
* Proven IT development experience as well as experience of multi-cultural project teams, where parts are located off-site
* Excellent communication skills in English, both orally and written


**Advantagous**
* Swedish communication skills, both orally and written
* Knowledge in .NET/Java frameworks
* Working knowledge of CAD tools, PLM-CAD-ERP and other enterprise integrations


 We are looking for a team player who sees the team’s contribution as the ultimate goal. Additionally, you should be a self-going and communicative person with natural leader instincts, drive and independence.
   

  

**Our PLM team**
 Capgemini Engineering are experts within Digital Continuity. One of our main offerings within Digital Continuity is PLM (Product Lifecycle Management). Capgemini has more than 3000 PLM experts implementing and maintaining PLM solutions globally. We have strategic partnerships with the major PLM Vendors like Dassault, PTC, Siemens, and Aras. Our global footprint is huge within several different industry sectors and clients like Airbus, P&G, Dräger, Burberry, BMW, DELL, Johnson & Johnson and many more. Capgemini can offer full PLM transformations and E2E offerings, from strategy, define & develop processes, build and implement to managed services.
   

  

 With our local Nordic Digital Continuity team, we work closely with our Nordic clients and leverage all the knowledge, experiences, assets and frameworks that we have globally. This is a great opportunity and benefit for our clients. Our local Digital Continuity client base and local team is constantly growing, and we are continuously looking for new talents within Digital Continuity, PLM and closely related domains.
   

  

 In our Nordic team we are pooling experts together, creating a place where we can be inspired, inspire others, coach and be coached, and find a common ground for insights and deliveries. We want you to become a part of our team, to help us grow and let the synergies of great talent take us to new levels with our clients and with the rest of Capgemini.
   

  

 Join us and Get The Future You Want!
   

  

 Welcome with your application!

title: Nordics Quality Lead
description:
Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.
   

  

 With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.
   

  

 This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Haleon is seeking a strategic Quality Lead for Nordic Region to join our passionate team in Northern Europe. This is your chance to become a key architect of the area strategy, leveraging your expertise to drive quality performance, craft insightful analysis, and propel the area towards ambitious goals while ensuring full compliance with the applicable regulation for our vast portfolio (Medicines, Medical devices, Food supplements, cosmetics & General goods).
   

  

 In this role you will partner up with Business and Supply Chain functions to drive E2E impact, value creation, cost efficiency, customer satisfaction and top supply service.
   

  

 This position can be based in Stockholm, Sweden or Copenhagen, Denmark and reports into the Head of Commercial Quality Europe.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 This role will provide you the opportunity to lead key activities to progress your career, these responsibilities include some of the following:
   

  

* Direct the overall strategy, plan ahead, and deliver Quality Operational performance, Compliance, and Excellence. Provide strategic leadership for up to 3 years to meet enterprise goals.
* Grow yourself and others. Lead a dynamic Quality team in this region and nurture a high-performance culture. Deliver on capability and development commitments. Plan targeted succession planning for key roles in your area. Build the associated capabilities and develop a flexible pool of Quality Compliance and Excellence resources to deliver the QSC ambition (and associated metrics) within the area.
* Drive continuous improvement and operational excellence YoY.
* Partner with the Supply Chain & Commercial teams, translating quality insights into winning strategies. Leverage product Quality to support Consumer First Agenda.
* Provide strategic and technical leadership direction, consistent with QSC and Commercial priorities. Drive meaningful quality resolutions.
* Nurture positive and collaborative relationships across E2E supply chain to drive Quality Commercial deliveries and bring customer focus view at the centre. Balance quality deliveries and impact against growth and profitability targets
* Lead at Haleon: Join the Leadership Team to shape long-term strategy and execute for success. Influence 360 senior leadership in support of the Quality Strategy and intent.
* Identify and implement continuous improvement initiatives to optimize GxP processes.
* Ensure end to end compliance with Quality and Regulatory guidelines, including ongoing inspection readiness for audits (Internal, external) and robust quality governance.
* Identify and mitigate quality risks in the supply chain. Enable Business continuation plans upon need.


**Qualifications And Skills Essential**
**Education:**
* Degree in pharmaceutical life sciences or equivalent (Biology, Chemistry, Microbiology, etc).


**Experience:**
* Min at least 5 years with demonstrated experience in leadership strategic roles. Demonstrated experience in setting strategy and drive quality value by leveraging the vast quality knowledge within the wider business context.
* Fast moving consumer Healthcare companies, GxP technical knowledge demonstrated in both GMP and GDP. Demonstrated experience in driving both compliance (depth) and operational performance.
* This role requires travelling and could be based in Denmark or Sweden.


 Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/
