title: DevOps Engineer - Cloud, Infrastructure and Orchestration
description:
TRATON R&D
   

  

 The TRATON Research & Development (R&D) organization is going through a major transformation with the target to become an even stronger Group by completing the establishment of a worldwide Group R&D organization. We will set ourselves up to be able to fully deliver the time-critical Group R&D roadmap and to fulfil the high expectations to deliver outstanding customer value and drive effectiveness. This enables us to secure competitiveness in our business, in other words, win market positions and ensure Group R&D is a strong business partner for TRATON Group and the brands (Scania, MAN, INTERNATIONAL, Volkswagen Truck & Bus).
   

  

 Autonomous Transport plays a central role in this transformation. We are now looking for a new colleague within Autonomous Transport who wants to join us in building the platform that powers autonomous vehicle control and monitoring.
   

  

 Position details
   

  

  

* What kind of position/job is this? This is a full-time/permanent position within the TRATON Group R&D
* Where is the job located? This position is based in Södertälje, Sweden
* Who will I be reporting to? Reporting line – TGRAAEI: Johannes Slettengren


**About Us**
 We are part of the Development Environment and Tools section within TRATON Group Research & Development. Our focus is to develop cloud-based systems (AWS) that ensure automated, optimized, and safe control and monitoring of autonomous vehicles. All of this is built into one unified platform – and we’d love your help to take it even further.
   

  

 Your tasks
   

  

 We’re expanding our Development Platform team and are looking for someone who wants to help build the infrastructure for our off-board software (technology operating outside the vehicle). In this role, you’ll be central to building and managing the cloud-based backbone of our autonomous vehicle platform using modern DevOps tools and practices.
   

  

 Your mission is to:
   

  

  

* Design, build, and maintain scalable platforms for reliable applications using tools such as Kubernetes, AWS, AWS CDK, Cilium, GitLab CI/CD, Crossplane, IAM, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate technologies smoothly into our ecosystem.
* Take part in the full software lifecycle – from idea and development to deployment and maintenance.
* Solve complex technical challenges with a focus on performance, reliability, and continuous improvement.


 Your qualification
   

  

 You are a collaborative team player who enjoys sharing knowledge and exploring new ideas. You are proactive, curious, and comfortable working in a dynamic, evolving environment.
   

  

 You are structured, analytical, and take security seriously. You thrive in a team setting, value clear communication, and are driven by delivering high-quality results. Your passion lies in platform technology, automation, and DevSecOps.
   

  

 We think you’ll need:
   

  

  

* Solid work experience with Kubernetes, AWS, CI/CD, and Infrastructure as Code.
* A degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* It’s a bonus if you’ve worked with identity and access management (IAM) tools like Keycloak.


 Familiarity with any of the following is highly beneficial:
   

  

 Terraform, Terragrunt, Karpenter, Crossplane, DynamoDB, Grafana, Tempo, Loki, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, ArgoCD, GitLab pipelines, Python, Bash, Go, Apache Kafka, Cilium, Redis.
   

  

 Meet your future manager
   

  

 Hi! I’m Johannes, and my job is to support you and our team in doing meaningful work, having fun, and continuously improving how we help our customers and shape our platform. I’m curious by nature and always want to understand the "why" behind what we do.
   

  

 I believe in transparency, trust, and courage – and I strive to build a team culture that reflects these values.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 At TRATON R&D, we offer a healthy and inspiring workplace that values every individual. You’ll have excellent opportunities to shape your work, develop your skills, and influence your future.
   

  

 We believe in modern leadership and agile ways of working – and we think you’ll thrive in that environment. We work both from home and in our offices in Södertälje, so you’ll be able to find a good work-life balance that suits you.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center, Gröndal, or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. TRATON also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Selections and interviews will be held continuously throughout the application period. Please apply by 2025-04-22 at the latest. Your application should include a CV and degree certificate. Instead of a cover letter, we ask you to answer a few short questions when submitting your application. Please note that a background check may be part of the recruitment process.
   

  

 Looking forward to connecting!
   

  

 For more information, please contact Johannes Slettengren, Head of Continuous Integration and Delivery, at +46-8-553 70758.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**DevOps Engineer** 




  





  





**The Role** 




  





  





 We are seeking a talented DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic Database Services (DBS) team. In this role, you will be responsible for architecting and developing automation solutions for our diverse database services. You will collaborate with a team of highly skilled professionals in a fast-paced environment, leveraging your automation and DevOps expertise to enhance our DBS offerings. We are looking for someone who is eager to apply their DevOps knowledge to improve automation across various databases, including Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Solace, Kafka, and AWS. While experience with these specific databases is not required, it is considered as a plus. A willingness to have a close collaboration within the team as well as learning and adapting is essential.
 



  





  





**Main responsibilities:** 




  





  




* Lead the automation efforts to deliver a scalable database environment
* Participate in the definition of the requirements on the infrastructure for the services DBS are responsible for
* Participate in tests and verification of new products within DBS responsibilities
* Collaborate to achieve common goals both within the team and across departments
* Keep up to date with new automation and infrastructure technologies
* Foster a culture of knowledge sharing and mentoring
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





  





**Skills and Requirements** 




  





  




* Deep knowledge in building automation solution using Ansible, Python and Terraform – preferably 3+ year experience
* Experience in building scalable and distributed infrastructure
* It is an advantage if you have some knowledge in database administration, but not a requirement
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to contribute to architectural and tech management discussions
* Comfortable running workshops and training sessions
* Good at collaboration and both verbal and written communication.
* Development mindset focused on cost optimization and performance

title: Oracle Devops Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative, and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for an Oracle DevOps Engineer to join our DevOps team.
   

  

**About Cognizant EAS-Oracle**
 Cognizant is a highly respected and successful IT & business transformation partner for many distinguished organizations globally. We work with the world’s leading organizations to provide collaborative solutions to their business and IT challenges with innovative ideas. As Oracle solution practice (EAS-Oracle) our expertise in cloud and Oracle delivery empowers our customers with best-in-class service for digital transformation across 15 verticals including: banking and financial services, healthcare, retail, consumer goods and insurance.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As part of a DevOps team you will be building, supporting, migrating, and automating the Oracle environment on Exadata Cloud at Customer (ExaCC). Products supported within that environment include Oracle databases, Oracle Enterprise Manager, Oracle Key Vault and ExaCC.
   

  

 You will engineer the solution to build ExaCC platform to be compliant to regulatory requirements. You will be extensively working on Oracle Database migrations to ExaCC.
   

  

 A part of the workload will be developing the infrastructure as code to support CI/CD pipeline based on products such as Git, Jenkins, Ansible and Python.
   

  

 Your day-to-day activities will range from actual engineering the Database migrations and coding automation scripts to engineering new or adapted solutions for the customer. As part of the migration delivery team you will also be responsible for configuration of monitoring, maximum availability architecture (MAA) and support during and after the cutover window.
   

  

 You will work closely together with other teams and the Product Owner.
   

  

**Our ideal candidate**
* You are an experienced Oracle database administrator with Exadata/ExaCC knowledge and like to work in a DevOps team in a complex environment
* You love challenges and are motivated to achieve the project objectivesm. You are a team player, but also a self-starter
* You see the big-picture but like to go in detail to solve complex integration issues
* Experience with DevOps, Scrum, Agile
* Extensive experience with Oracle Enterprise Manager, Oracle Enterprise Linux and virtualization
* Good knowledge of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure


**What You Can Expect**
* Become part of a the ‘flag ship’ success story - We go through enormous growth!
* Based in the Nordics – we have offices in Norway, Denmark and Sweden in an European and Global network
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
* Open, ‘can do’ team spirit
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* To work on various challenging clients and projects


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
   

  

 For more information contact: Cajsa.orvenholt@cognizant.com

title: DevOps Engineer
description:

Your expertise in developing scripts and automation tools will streamline operations and reduce manual workflows, making everything run smoothly. Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.

title: Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer** 
 to our Information Systems (IS) team. This role is an opportunity for an "automation-first" technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have experience of IT operations automation, Infrastructure as Code and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The IS team at Canonical supports and maintains all of Canonical's IT production services. The team is in charge of running services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.
   

  

 As an SRE & Gitops engineer you'll be in a unique position to drive operations automation to the next level, both in our own private clouds as well as in the public clouds. We do this by utilizing the best of open source infrastructure as code software, software development practices such as CI/CD pipelines, and Canonical's leading products for software operation automation.
   

  

 In addition to defining the infrastructure as code, you will improve Canonical products and the open-source technologies they're based on by providing critical feedback to developers on how their products operate at scale. This is done by submitting bugs (and sometimes writing pull requests) and collaborating on design and implementations with other teams within the company.
   

  

 You'll be part of a global team of SREs that work together and support each other to provide the best possible services to our company, Canonical's customers and the Ubuntu Community.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role is available remotely in any timezone.
   

  

 As a Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer engineer you will
   

  

* Apply your experience of IaC to develop infrastructure as code practice within IS by constantly increasing automation and improving IaC processes
* Automate software operations for re-usability and consistency across private and public clouds, taking into consideration the complexities of distributed systems
* Develop new features and improve the resilience and scalability of the existing cloud and container portfolio at Canonical
* Maintain operational responsibility for all of Canonical's core services, networks, and infrastructure
* Develop skills in troubleshooting, capacity planning, and performance investigation, Setting up, maintaining and using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and Elasticsearch; design, implement and maintain monitoring and alerting for various systems and services
* Collaborate with development teams to design service architecture, documentation, playbooks, policies and operational procedures
* Provide assistance and work with globally distributed engineering, operations, and support peers
* Be given uninterrupted development time to focus on larger projects and automation of manual tasks
* Share your experience, know-how and best practices with other team members in design sessions, mentorship and 'doing work together'
* Carry final responsibility for time-critical escalations


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* A deep experience of, and knowledge to define operations in code, using version control, peer review and CI/CD to roll out changes both to applications and infrastructure
* Strong modern engineering background (peer-review, unit testing, SCM, CI/CD, Agile)
* Python software development experience, with large projects
* Practical knowledge of Linux networking, routing, and firewalls
* Affinity with various forms of Linux storage, from Ceph to Databases
* Hands-on experience administering enterprise Linux servers
* Extensive knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies
* Bachelor's degree or greater, preferably in computer science or related engineering field
* Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English over email, chat, video or voice calls and in-person
* Motivated and able to troubleshoot from kernel to web, and willing to ask others when appropriate
* A willingness to be flexible and able to learn new things quickly
* Be inspired by the needs of fast-changing environments
* Happy to work within distributed teams
* Be passionate and familiarized about open-source, especially Ubuntu or Debian


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: DevOps Tekniker
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vår konsultorganisation behöver förstärka med fler duktiga DevOps-tekniker som är redo att ta sig an uppdrag för våra kunder.
   

  

 Du får arbeta med spännande projekt, både på plats och på distans, och vara en del av ett starkt team. Vi erbjuder utvecklingsmöjligheter, förmåner som föräldralön och aktieprogram, samt en flexibel arbetsmiljö
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I denna roll arbetar du som konsult för våra kunder som behöver din expertis inom DevOps Våra kunder är stora företag eller organisationer inom offentlig sekor. Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande, men sträcker sig från nyutveckling till förvaltning. Du förväntas arbeta både hands-on och praktiskt, men även med analys, planering och strategi.
   

  

 Arbetet kan utföras hos kund, på något av CGI´s kontor i Stockholm eller på distans från hemmet, det beror på kundens önskemål och krav. De flesta av våra konsulter har en hybridlösning, där man varierar.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Här behöver du några års arbetsliverfarenhet inom relevant område.
   

  

* Du har erfarenhet av DevOps antingen genom dina eftergymnasiala IT-utbildning alternativt har du förskaffat dig erfarenheten genom din arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Kubernetes eller Docker
* AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Plattform
* Linux
* CI/CD


 Som konsult är det viktigt att man är flexibel och gillar att möta och samarbeta med nya personer. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper som exempelvis nyfikenhet, kreativitet, promblemlösningsförmåga. Man behöver också en positiv inställnig och man trivs med att arbeta med ett stort kundfokus
   

  

**To applicants: Please note that this position requires both Swedish and English language skills on a professional level, verbally as well as in writing.**
 Vill du veta mer?
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten kontakta rekryterande ledare Marcus Gridange, marcus.grindange@cgi.com. Vi tillämpar löpande urval skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:
   

  

* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


 Övrigt
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Project Manager Radiology Sweden
company_industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
We are one of Europe's leading suppliers of clinical laboratory testing and medical diagnostic imaging services to private and public healthcare providers, local governments, insurance companies, pharmaceutical companies and the general public. We operate laboratory and medical diagnostic imaging facilities in 14 countries: Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Norway, Peru, Portugal, Slovakia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, UAE, and the United Kingdom. Our network of facilities provides us with one of the broadest geographic footprints of any clinical laboratory and medical diagnostic services provider in Europe.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks / Your Responsibilities**
* Managing a multi-project environment at Unilabs Nordics across all aspects of the radiology business
* Project Management Office responsibilities, including:
+ Acts primarily as Project Manager for Key Projects and coordinates Projects managed by Line Management
+ Project Reporting, Controlling, and Auditing/Gatekeeping where appropriate
+ Informing senior management on (programs), projects, and portfolio status
+ Supplying up-to-date PMO standards and methodology
+ Increasing the degree of project management maturity in Unilabs Nordics
+ Ensuring ongoing risk assessment and mitigation across all projects

* Supporting the construction of new radiology centers, ensuring integration of HVAC, electrical, and construction aspects into project management planning
* Coordinating Unilabs Nordics' cost Radiology transformation program, including reporting to senior management and Unilabs Group and active participation in program initiatives
* Driving Unilabs' Continuous Improvement Process to identify efficiency-gaining opportunities with staff from all departments
* Providing a collaborative framework for these teams to improve communication and generate ideas for continuous improvement


**What we offer**
* A modern working environment in our large radiology organisation
* Work in a motivated and open-minded team
* A competitive salary and above-average social benefits
* 40-hour week with time clock and 5 weeks holiday
* Career development in a leading company in the Nordics and Europe
* Located in Sweden, available to travel around Nordics (around 20%)


**Requirements**
* 5 years of consolidated experience in managing complex projects/programs, possibly in international environments
* Experience in medical projects/programs, with some knowledge of medical environments or radiology (would be a plus)
* Knowledge or experience in construction project management, particularly related to HVAC, electrical, and general facility setup
* Ability to manage and lead small teams/groups (up to 10 people) in a smooth, cohesive, and inclusive manner with no direct report to the incumbent
* Open to working in a matrix organization and different role interactions
* Solid background in the IT business and knowledge of business process analysis
* Pro-active, respectful, resilient, results-oriented, able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously while grasping the essence and maintaining the direction of the project/program, strongly pragmatic, hands-on, and able to zoom-in zoom-out
* Knowledgeable about process improvement methodologies: Lean, Six Sigma, DevOps
* Open-minded, motivated, and willing to step out of their comfort zone while raising new challenges in a stimulating & innovative working environment
* Driven by data and KPIs
* Languages: English & Swedish

title: Sr. DevOps Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 Sr. DevOps Engineer
   

  

**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The O** 
**pportunity**
 At Worldline, delivering a fantastic payment experience that our customers love is what we burn for. Our cloud-native acquiring platform is processing billions of card transactions including authorization processing and clearing and settlement for our customers to trust. Currently, we are looking for a skilled product oriented Sr DevOps engineer to team up with one of our empowered product DevOps teams.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
 Our autonomous teams work with a lean product focused DevOps culture that continuously delivers true outcome, and if you build it, you run it! This means that you are responsible for:
   

  

* Active participation and contribution in all phases of the product lifecycle including discovery, delivery and operations.
* Delivering your team’s committed objectives, adapting to whatever is needed to reach the goal you and your team have committed yourselves to reach.
* Securing an outstanding qualitative service availability 24/7/365 and on-call duty is expected according to a rotating schedule.


 You love identifying the outcomes to be achieved together with your team, our customers, our internal users, other stakeholders and suppliers to deliver a truly outstanding acquiring processing experience for our customer and our business to love.
   

  

**What Makes You Stand Out**
* You have previous experience from the card-payment industry, preferably acquiring processing or other transaction intense industry.
* Are skilled in AWS and micro-services and serverless technologies.
* Are passionate about delivering a payment acquiring experience that brings value for our customers and our business.
* Highly collaborative, setting your team first while also successfully collaborating with others.
* A role model for your team and others by paying attention to commitment, accountability and the true outcome for yourself, your team, our customers and internal users.
* Are comfortable in a fast-moving and agile culture - handling many different stakeholders, prioritizations and fast decisions is not an issue for you.


**Who Are We Looking For**
 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. You also:
   

  

* Have confirmed experience in software development and coding in various languages including Java, Python, JS, and SQL etc.
* Background in micro-service, high availability and serverless software architecture and design running on AWS distributed over several availability zones and regions.
* As a result, we would like you also to have proficient knowledge in
* AWS cloud services including DynamoDB, Lambdas, ESC, RDS, Terraform, CloudFormation.
* Jenkins Pipeline and GIT, CI/CD, Release on Demand
* Docker
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, engineering or other meaningful field
* Deepened knowledge of software architecture and design including information security and experience from high-available API platforms is
* A deep understanding of software quality assurance principles
* Fluency in English and Swedish
* Valid working permit for Sweden (office location is Stockholm)


**Skills We’d Like**
* Experience from DevOps ways of working and lean culture
* Paying attention to commitment, accountability and result for yourself and for your team.
* Experience from developing secure and/or PCI-DSS certified solutions is considered an advantage
* Good communication and presentation abilities
* Challenging status quo
* Having a technical and curious mindset, continuously learning and sharing your knowledge with your peers and others.


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

**Learn more about life at Worldline at** 
**jobs.worldline.com**
**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Node.js/AWS/K8s) - Infra Engineering
description:
**Who We Are Is What We Do.**
 Deel and our family of growing companies are made up of global teams dedicated to helping businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily.
   

  

 The team comprises over three thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 100 countries, and our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the platform and products for customers.
   

  

 Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. Our market-leading technology, expertise, and global team are crucial to the platform’s success. We deliver the best products and features in our space, enabling millions of jobs worldwide and connecting the global workforce with the best companies and opportunities.
   

  

**Why should you be part of our success story?**
 A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer dictate how companies hire because exceptional talent lives everywhere. Deel sees a world without hiring borders and endless talent that pairs perfect candidates with great companies.
   

  

 We offer global teams all the tools they need to hire, onboard, manage, pay, and scale at full speed. We aim to foster a diverse global economy by building a generational platform that seamlessly connects companies with talent worldwide.
   

  

 After our successful Series D in 2021, we raised another $50M in 2023, doubling our valuation to $12B. There’s never been a more exciting time to join Deel — the international payroll and compliance market leader.
   

  

**Get ready to:**
* Be a part of a truly cross-functional team
* Participate in product planning (From discovery all the way to deployment); We want your input at all stages of the Software Development Lifecycle!
* Collaborate! Our teams work together to develop robust new features, API’s, continuously improve our industry-leading products and find and fix any bugs at Deel Speed.
* Ensure our customers receive a white-glove experience with our products!


**What The Infra Engineering Team Does**
 The team was created to support Deel engineering growth and build a platform for product teams, so they could ship business value faster. Deel is at a very unique position because we are big enough that we need the platform but we are young enough to not have it yet. There is a dedicated DevOps team and they take care of the infrastructure, while we work on the edge between DevOps and engineering enforcing standards and best practices, creating tooling, maintaining internal libraries, providing architectural guidance and owning some high-loaded core services, responding to production incidents when needed. It’s 70% Engineering and 30% DevOps. We have a lot of freedom, but it comes with responsibility.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
* 7+ years of experience in engineering
* Strong node.js knowledge
* AWS or similar cloud experience
* Kubernetes, Helm and Docker knowledge
* Experience with Postgres/Mysql, RabbitMq/Nats/Kafka
* Strong system design and problem solving skills, we often deal with the “unknown”
* Strong communication skills, we often need to orchestrate projects with 20+ teams
* You are hands-on troubleshooter
* You are ready for challenges


**Extra brownie points if you…**
* Have experience building internal tooling: npm packages, frameworks


**Total Rewards**
 Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.
   

  

**Some things you’ll enjoy**
* Provided computer equipment tailored to your role
* Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
* Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
* The flexibility of remote work, including WeWork access where available


**DISCLOSURE**
 We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications.Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.
   

  

 We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on the 19th of February, 2025.
   

  

 For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy.
   

  

 You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144.
   

  

 At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
   

  

*Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @* 
*deel.com* 
*and other acquired company emails like @* 
*payspace.com* 
*, @* 
*paygroup.com* 
*and @* 
*safeguardglobal.com* 
 .
 *You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visiting* 
*our careers page* 
*.*
*Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.
   

  

 Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.*

title: Cloud Specialist till Cloudo
description:
Cloudo är en komplett, oberoende leverantör av produkter samt tjänster inom IT. Vi är inte ensamma på området men noggranna med att urskilja oss. Vi ser till att våra kunder, liten som stor blir nöjda oavsett vad.
   

  

 Detta har vi gjort i över 20 år. Följer man detta enkla recept uppstår ofta möjligheten att utveckla samarbete med er som kund och att bli en helhetspartner för dig och ditt företag.
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Cloudo är en innovativ leverantör av moln-, IT- och telefonitjänster inom B2B. Vi befinner oss mitt i en otrolig tillväxtresa och söker nu en passionerad Cloud Specialist. Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara med och forma framtiden i ett företag som värdesätter engagemang och ambition.
   

  

**Om rollen:** 
 Som Cloud Specialist hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i våra kunders resa mot molnet. Du kommer att ansvara för licenser och CSP, samt Microsoft 365 och Azure. Du kommer att ta fram lösningar, onboarda och utveckla kunder kring dessa tjänster. Dessutom kommer du att agera expert under säljmöten med kund och säljare.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Ansvara för licenser och CSP
* Implementera och optimera Microsoft 365-tjänster
* Utveckla och förvalta lösningar i Azure
* Onboarda och utveckla kunder kring våra tjänster
* Agera expert under säljmöten med kund och säljare
* Säkerställa hög tillgänglighet, prestanda och säkerhet i våra molnlösningar
* Automatisera processer och implementera DevOps-principer
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att integrera molntjänster i våra applikationer


**Kvalifikationer**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsoft Azure och Microsoft 365
* Djup kunskap om molnarkitektur och säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure
* Certifieringar inom Microsoft Azure (t.ex. Azure Solutions Architect, Azure Administrator) är meriterande
* God förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar till både teknisk och icke-teknisk personal
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* Tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön
* Utvecklingsplan och kompetensutveckling
* Hälsoförsäkring och pension


**Start:** 
 Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid och när säkerhetskontroll är genomförd. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare.
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Lund eller Stockholm City
   

  

**Ansökan:** 
 Vi rekryterar löpande. Så skicka in din ansökan redan idag

title: Senior Testledare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Att planera och leda testarbete inom SAP.
* ECC till S/4HANA migrering
* Hands-on-kunskap om verktyg som Azure DevOps, JIRA, SAP Solution Manager, Tosca Tricentis och LoadRunner.
* Förmåga att skapa testplaner, testkoncept och testfall samt analysera och lösa defekter i en SAP kontext.
* Integrationstester, end-to-end-tester och acceptanstester.
* Vana att rapportera testresultat och presentera dem för projektledare och kunder.
* Förmåga att leda och coacha testteam, både internt och externt.
* Ett intresse för att driva innovation inom testautomation och kvalitetssäkring.
* Presales och rådgivning inom teststrategier är meriterande.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 04-04-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Chef Service Delivery
description:
*Vill du leda och utveckla ett team som arbetar med att leverera en modern och stabil infrastruktur för Länsförsäkringar? Har du ett starkt intresse för förändringsarbete och vill vara med och påverka framtidens leveransmodell? Vi söker dig som trivs i en ledarroll där du stöttar och utvecklar ditt team i en agil och molnbaserad miljö.*
**Om jobbet**
 Länsförsäkringar befinner sig i en mycket spännande digitaliseringsresa med tydlig vision och starkt stöd från ledningen gällande agila arbetssätt, molntjänster och innovation. Inom avdelningen Development Solutions & Operation Platforms (DSOP) är vi mitt i denna resa. Vi söker nu en chef för gruppen Service Delivery (SD) inom Private Cloud Platforms. Du kommer att leda ett team av 13 medarbetare bestående av Service Delivery Managers, arkitekter och Demand Managers. Din roll innebär att vara gränssnittet mot våra affärsenheter och säkerställa att DSOP:s leverans möter efterfrågan över tid. Du kommer att ha möjlighet att etablera en ny leveransmodell och påverka framtida arbetssätt och roller.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Leda och stödja ditt team genom att inspirera och motivera medarbetarna, planera och organisera arbetsuppgifter, samt utveckla personalen.
* Kommunicera effektivt både inom teamet och med högre ledning, lösa problem och fatta beslut.
* Utvärdera teamets prestationer, hantera administrativa uppgifter, delta i rekrytering och onboarding av nya medarbetare.
* Bidra till den strategiska planeringen för att säkerställa att teamets arbete är i linje med organisationens mål.
* Agera som gränssnitt mot våra affärsenheter med det övergripande ansvaret att säkra att DSOP leverans möter efterfrågan över tid.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete i linjechefsroller och ledning av team inom IT-infrastruktur eller applikationsområdet.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt enligt SAFe och leveransmodeller byggda på DevOps som skapar sömlösa samarbetsformer tvärs applikation- och infrateam.
* Erfarenhet av outsourcad leverans och samverkan med externa partners.
* Teknisk grund och god förståelse för infrastruktur och applikation.
* Erfarenhet av moderna leverans- och servicemodeller med kunden i fokus.
* Erfarenhet av etablering av förändrade arbetssätt och förändringsledning i stora organisationer med stor involvering av teamet.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från arbete inom försäkrings- och/eller bankverksamhet, och därmed organisationer med högt ställda säkerhets- och regulatoriska krav.


 Som person hittar du energi i att arbeta med att utveckla individer, organisation och verksamheten. Du drivs av att arbeta med förändringsledning och att skapa positiv atmosfär och framåtanda runt omkring dig. Ditt prestigelösa sätt och din samarbetsförmåga gör att du uppnår samsyn med dina kollegor och stakeholders. Du är bra på att förankra och driva igenom förändring i en komplex bolagsstruktur och är uthållig i din strävan att åstadkomma resultat tillsammans med andra. Att skapa struktur för dig själv, och tydlighet för andra, faller dig naturligt och i ditt ledarskap verkar du för att skapa ett harmoniskt och effektivt team.
   

  

**Din ledarprofil**
 Att vara ledare hos oss innebär att du leder med riktning, empati och energi. Tillsammans ska vi samarbeta för helheten och göra det enkelt att driva initiativ och arbeta mot våra gemensamma mål. Vi säkrar prestation genom att skapa en miljö som främjar utveckling, där varje medarbetare uppmuntras att visa mod för att nå sin fulla potential. Genom att skapa en trygg miljö ger du plats för våra medarbetare att växa.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Enheten Digital & IT har en mycket central roll för hela Länsförsäkringars verksamhet och ansvarar för utveckling och drift av länsförsäkringsgruppens IT-miljö. DSOP ansvarar för utveckling och förvaltning av IT-infrastruktur, drift- och kommunikationstjänster utifrån affärsverksamhetens krav och behov. Vi har även ansvaret för att leverera en utvecklarupplevelse i världsklass. Arbetet sker i tätt samarbete med de fyra affärsenheterna Bank, SAK, LIV och Agria.
   

  

 Gruppen Private Cloud Platforms, inom enheten Development Solutions & Operation Platforms, har som uppgift att leverera tillgängliga, säkra och stabila hybrida IT-infrastrukturtjänster till Länsförsäkringar som möter både dagens och framtidens behov med kunden i fokus.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-25**

title: Lab Director – Wireless Network Algorithms Laboratory
description:
**Join Our Team**
**About The Company**
 Founded in 1988, Huawei Technologies is one of the fastest growing telecommunications and network solutions providers in the world. At Huawei Technologies, we look for people who share our vision: to enrich life with communication. We are a leading supplier of next generation telecom networks and currently serve 37 of the world’s top 50 operators. Our people are committed to providing innovative products, services and solutions and understand it as their mission to create long-term value and growth potential for our clients.
   

  

 The Huawei office in Sweden is the leading overseas R&D office in Huawei, and the Wireless Network Algorithm Lab at Huawei Sweden drives innovation for the Huawei Wireless RAN product. We work on both advanced transceivers and on Radio Resource Management algorithms, for 5.5G or 6G.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 We are seeking an
 **experienced and visionary Lab Director** 
 to lead our
 **Wireless Network Algorithms Laboratory** 
 . This role demands a unique blend of deep technical expertise in wireless communication systems, proven leadership in managing high-performing teams, and the ability to bridge cutting-edge research with real-world industrial applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both academia and industry, driving innovation while ensuring the lab’s work aligns with global technological advancements and business needs.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Strategic Leadership & Team Management:
* Define and execute the lab’s strategic vision, focusing on advanced wireless communication algorithms (e.g., 5G/6G, AI/ML-driven optimization).
* Lead, mentor, and grow a multidisciplinary team of researchers, engineers, and academic collaborators.
* Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
* Manage lab resources, budgets, and infrastructure to maximize research impact and operational efficiency.
* Research & Development Excellence:
* Oversee groundbreaking research in wireless network algorithms, ensuring outputs are published in top-tier journals and conferences.
* Translate academic research into industrial solutions by collaborating with product teams, telecom partners, and stakeholders.
* Stay ahead of industry trends (e.g., 5.5G/6G evolving techs, AI/ML integration) and guide the lab’s technical roadmap.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration:
* Build partnerships with universities, research institutions, and industry leaders to secure funding and joint projects.
* Act as the lab’s ambassador at global conferences, standards bodies, and innovation forums.
* Facilitate knowledge transfer between academia and industry to accelerate commercialization of research outcomes.
* Operational & Quality Governance:
* Ensure compliance with ethical standards, intellectual property management, and safety protocols.
* Monitor research quality and impact through regular reviews, audits, and performance metrics.
* Identify skill gaps and design training programs to upskill team members on emerging technologies.
* Stakeholder Engagement & Reporting:
* Prepare and present progress reports to senior leadership, highlighting key achievements and ROI.
* Engage with internal stakeholders (e.g., product, engineering, DevOps) to align lab priorities with business needs.
* Secure external grants, sponsorships, and partnerships to expand the lab’s capabilities and influence.


**Qualifications**
* PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Telecommunications, or a related field.
* 10+ years of hands-on experience in wireless communication systems, with expertise in areas like signal processing, network optimization, or AI/ML for wireless networks.
* 5+ years of leadership experience managing technical teams in both academic and industrial settings (e.g., research labs, R&D departments).
* Strong publication record in reputed journals/conferences (e.g., IEEE, ACM) and patents in wireless technologies.
* Proven success in securing funding (grants, industry partnerships) and delivering large-scale research projects.
* Deep understanding of wireless standards (3GPP, IEEE), simulation tools (MATLAB, NS-3), and industrial practices.
* Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to diverse audiences.


**Preferred Skills**
* Experience in commercializing research (e.g., spin-offs, licensing agreements).
* Familiarity with telecom industry ecosystems (e.g., Ericsson, Huawei, Nokia) and open-source initiatives.


**Shape the Future of Wireless Communication with Us!**
 If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of wireless technology while bridging academia and industry, we invite you to lead our lab and drive the next wave of innovation. Apply today!

title: Senior Applikationskonsult\Streamlead Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finans
description:
At Sogeti, we believe the best is inside every one of us. Whether you are early in your career or at the top of your game, we’ll encourage you to fulfill your potential to be better. Through our shared passion for technology, our entrepreneurial culture , and our focus on continuous learning, we’ll provide everything you need to do your best work and become the best you can be.
   

  

**Senior Applikationskonsult\Streamlead Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finans**
**Din roll**
 Som Streamlead Dynamics 365 FO hos Sogeti kommer du att vara involverad i att leda implementeringen och optimeringen av finansiella processer med hjälp av Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations. Du kommer att använda din expertis för att ge teknisk ledning och säkerställa framgångsrik projektleverans.
   

  

**I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:**
* Implementering och konfigurering av Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations-moduler för att möta kundernas behov.
* Analysera och optimera finansiella processer för att förbättra effektivitet och noggrannhet.
* Ge expertråd om bästa praxis för finansiell förvaltning inom Dynamics 365.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att säkerställa framgångsrik projektleverans.


**Din profil**
* Minst kandidatexamen i finans, redovisning eller relaterat område.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet som senior applikationskonsult/streamlead med fokus på Dynamics 365 Finance.
* Stark förståelse av finansiella processer och bästa praxis.
* Utmärkta problemlösningsfärdigheter och uppmärksamhet på detaljer.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt samt som del av ett team.
* Starka kommunikations- och interpersonella färdigheter.
* Certifiering i Dynamics 365 Finance.
* Erfarenhet av andra Dynamics 365-moduler som Supply Chain Management eller Customer Engagement.
* Kunskap om Power Platform eller Copilot ses som stort plus.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
* Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
* Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
* Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
* Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.


**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan idag, urval sker löpande! Hoppas vi ses! Vill du veta mer? Kontakta TA Partner Marta Sundell så berättar hon gärna mer.
   

  

 Part of the Capgemini Group, Sogeti makes business value through technology for organizations that need to implement innovation at speed and want a local partner with global scale. With a hands-on culture and close proximity to its clients, Sogeti implements solutions that will help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. By combining its agility and speed of implementation through a DevOps approach, Sogeti delivers innovative solutions in quality engineering, cloud and application development, all driven by AI, data and automation.

title: Electronics Test Engineer
description:
